loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy chicks and poultry feed for a poultry business

loans.name: Edita

texts.en: This time, for her 4th loan, Edita is borrowing PHP 14,000, with which she intends to buy grocery items for her store to sell.  The basket weaving and pig fattening businesses that she previously funded through NWTF continue to provide Edita and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Srey By

texts.en:
Srey By is 32 years old. She is married and lives with her three children and her mother in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating agricultural crops for more than seven years, earning approximately $3 daily. Her husband is a construction worker who earns about $5 per day.

In order to improve her family’s finances, Srey By is requesting a loan of $600 to purchase cassava plants for cultivating. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her farming business and help her children access higher education. Moreover, Srey By hopes to build a new house as soon as possible.

loans.use: to purchase cassava plants for cultivating

loans.name: Savoeun

texts.en:
Savoeun is 45 years old. She is married and lives with her six children in Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She has been cultivating rice and fattening up animals for more than 10 years, earning approximately $4 daily. Her husband (who has joined her in the photo) is a construction worker. Additionally, he is a Khmer traditional singer who sings in wedding ceremonies. He earns about $5 each day. Three of her children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $12 daily. 

In order to improve her family’s finances, Savoeun is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase piglets to breed and sell when they gain weight. By doing so, she would earn more income for the family. In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children to access higher education. Moreover, Savoeun hopes to rebuild her house to make it more comfortable for her family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to breed and sell when they gain weight

loans.name: Anwaran

texts.en:
Ms Anwaran is a 44-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of selling cloth for the past year. She started this business with a few bundles of cloth, but with the passage of time she made progress in this field. Now she takes orders from the customers and also sells cloth at the market level. She became famous in her community by providing cloth in different colors and designs. She makes enough to contribute to the family income. 

She has eight children, two of them have jobs in a factory while the others are school going. She wants to give them higher education. Her husband is employed in a factory, and he is very satisfied with the working style of his wife and happy with the growth of her business. 

In order to meet the orders of her customers she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of  20,000 PKR to buy additional cloth in various colors and designs by considering the taste and choice of her customers. She wants to support her family for their bright future and prosperous life.

loans.use: to buy additional cloth in various colors and designs by considering the taste and choice of her customers.

loans.name: Rone

texts.en:
Due to financial difficulty, Rone put up a small variety store in their village for his wife to manage. They aimed to improve their source of living so that they will satisfy all their necessities and continue sending their four children to school. As responsible parents, they want their children to become professionals and have stable jobs. 

In this regard, Rone and his wife agreed to improve their small variety store, by increasing their product offerings to satisfy their customers' demand. But due to insufficient capital, Rone is asking for additional capital of PHP 20,000 to buy soft drinks, detergent, soaps, canned goods, noodles, eggs, snack foods, beverages and seasonings for sale. He believes that they will improve the business as they continue to work hard and strive harder.

loans.use: to buy various foods, soft drinks, and cleaning products to stock in the small general store his wife manages.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en: Severina is a hog raiser in the village where she lives. She is now 52 years old, and is widowed with five children. She would like to ensure the good growth and nutrition of her hogs so she is asking for a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her hog-raising business. This will help her hogs grow healthier and when they achieve the desired weight, she can sell them at a higher price. This will lead to additional income. Severina would like to keep expanding her business as a successful hog raiser for the overall welfare of her family. From this, she will be able to save funds to use in times of emergencies.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and vaccines for her hog-raising business

loans.name: Madurasa Group

texts.en:
Yaya, 37 years old, is married to Herwanfiar and blessed with four children; Vega is 15 years old, Jihan is 12 years old, Salsa is seven years old and Raya is three years old. 

She has run her general store in front of her house for four years. So far, her business has been running well, and she can get income of 500,000 IDR per week.  

Yaya will  use this loan to buy rice, soaps, toothpaste, and children's snacks for her general store and for her children's education needs and extracurricular activities. She hopes one day to have a big grocery store in her town.

loans.use: to buy soap, toothpaste and snacks

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom is 27 years old. She is married and lives with her two children in Kampot Province, Cambodia. She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up animals for more than eight years, earning approximately $6 daily. Her husband is a motor taxi driver who earns about $8 per day.

Khom is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase cattle to use for farming. This purchase will help Khom obtain enough physical resources to cultivate her crops. In the future, she would like to run a grocery store and help her children earn bachelors' degrees. Moreover, Khom hopes to rebuild her house to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to use for farming

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en:
Thelma is 49 years old, is married, and has three children, one of whom is in school. 
Thelma is in the agricultural business raising cattle in the Philippines. Thelma requested a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins, and minerals for her cattle.
Thelma has been raising cattle for 20 years now and has borrowed 16 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.
In the future, Thelma would like to save enough to expand her business and continue to send her child to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins, and minerals for her cattle.

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Cecelia works hard to support her family.
She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Cecelia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell to customers.
Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en: Leonida is 58 years old.  She is married and has three children.  To provide sustenance for her family, she and her husband patiently raise crops to sell.  They are rice and corn growers in the village where they live.  From her one hectare rice field and one hectare of corn, she generates about 30,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) each harvest season (twice a year). This revenue goes for meals, allowances and bills at home.  Together, they work hard for the family's sustenance.  Now she is requesting a loan of 35,000 PHP in order to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm.  This way she will ensure good crop growth.  She hopes to produce an abundant harvest to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and insecticides for her farm.

loans.name: Baba Dhabaleswar Group

texts.en:
Baba Dhabaleswar is a Joint Liability Group formed in the year 2012 by four active women entrepreneurs of Titilagarh town in Bolangir district in Odisha, India to avail a loan from Mahashakti Foundation to expand their existing business. Kanak is one of them. The lady standing on the extreme left in the photograph is Kanak. She is a very shy lady of 45 years who lives with her husband and one son who is 20 years old and studying in an engineering college out of state. She also has two daughters who are married and staying in their in-law’s houses. The lady standing on the extreme right with her hand raised is Sujata, the leader of the group.

Kanak has been running a screen printing and polymer stamp making unit in her house with the help of her husband for the last 20 years. Kanak takes orders for printing invitation cards and making polymer stamps and supplies ready made invitation cards to the customers. Her daily net income in marriage season (December-June) is 2000 INR and in normal season is 500 to 1000 INR. Her husband purchases the materials like chemicals, paper, polymer, color etc from the nearest wholesale market in Bolangir. To help her with the screen printing, she has engaged two skilled workers. Due to the quality work and timely delivery, her business has name and fame in the locality.  With the loan, Kanak wants to purchase cards, polymer, color and chemicals in bulk to reduce the purchasing cost as she replenishes her stock frequently. Kanak says that with this business she married her two daughters in a befitting manner and was able to send her son to school for his engineering degree. Now she hopes to construct a pucca house as the present house is a tile one.
 
The other three members of the group are Sujata, Chandrama and Bhumi who run a General store, a Tent House and a fast food center.

loans.use: To purchase cards, polymer, color and chemicals

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a 29-year-old married woman and mother of two young children from Getafe, Bohol. She and her husband have been engaged in a fishing business for more than 2 years now.

She is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to improve his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.

In the future, Geraldine dreams of expanding their business so that it will generate the income necessary for the needs of the family and for the schooling of their children.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is a 64-year-old married woman from Ubay, Bohol. She is the mother of four grown-up children. She has had a fishing business for more than thirty years now. Her husband works as a fisherman.

Juanita is asking for a loan to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and fuel for the boat. With this, her husband will be able to enhance his catch; thus, giving them more fish to sell at the market. In the future, Juanita hopes of making their business a success and saving money for reinvestment in the business and for general saving purposes.

loans.use: to buy new fishing nets, lead weights, buckets and fuel for the boat

loans.name: Manilyn

texts.en:
Manilyn is a 24-year-old married woman and the mother of two young children, ages 3 and 1. She lives with her family in Getafe, Bohol. She has run a sari-sari (variety) store for more than 2 years.

Manilyn is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell such as canned goods, candies and chips, noodles, and toiletries. Manilyn hopes to make her business a success in the future in order to save money for the future schooling of her two children.

loans.use: to buy more grocery and household items to sell

loans.name: Jefone

texts.en:
Jefone is a 19-year-old man from Getafe, Talibon.  He has a fishing business.

Jefone is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, hooks, buckets and others.  Through this, he will be able to enhance his catch thus giving them more fish to sell in the market.  Jefone wants to earn more so that he can help his family.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, hooks, buckets and others

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana is a 24 year old, confident, and independent woman. She is living in a rented house with her husband in the remote area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is an auto mechanic but his income is inadequate to fulfill the family needs and household expenses. 

Rehana is an efficient and hardworking tailor. Since 2010, she has been running a small tailoring business in her home. She provides tailoring services in her community. All of her customers appreciate for her efficient and excellent skills. Her income is playing a vital role in the family's income so she wants to continue it in the future as well. 

Currently her tailoring stock is not enough and her sewing machine has stopped working as well, therefore she is unable to continue her business. However due to the lack of money she is unable to purchase the needed materials for her business. 

As a member of six-person lending group, she has requested for a loan from Kiva's partners BRAC Pakistan to purchase reels of thread in various colours, cloth, needles and one sewing machine. This will not only help her to continue her small business but increase her net income as well. She desires to open a new shop and to live in her own house with her husband. 

Note: In the picture Rehana holds a pass book in her hand.

loans.use: to purchase some tailoring materials and a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Geronima

texts.en:
Geronima is a farmer from Talibon, Bohol.  She has been engaged in rice farming together with her husband for several years now.  This is the source of their income.

Geronima is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm.  With this, they will be able to produce a good quality harvest.  Geronima hopes to expand their business in order to improve their income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for the farm

loans.name: Adriana María

texts.es: Adriana de 41 años de edad, es una mujer a la que la vida le ha enseñado grandes lecciones. Hace 9 años decidió montar con su esposo un almacén de lencería, pero debido al maltrato físico del que fue víctima por parte de su pareja decidió separarse, quedándose sin ninguna entrada económica y dos hijos menores de edad que sostener. En medio de la dificultad su hermana la animó para que se dedicara a la venta ambulante de ropa, actividad que le permitió ahorrar y volver a montar su negocio. Hoy tiene grandes sueños los cuales espera materializar y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en surtido para la temporada de fin de año. Su prioridad es el bienestar de sus hijos por lo cual desea organizar su vivienda para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Adriana, age 41, is a woman who has learned important lessons in life. Nine years ago, she and her husband decided to open a lingerie store. After becoming a victim of physical abuse, she decided to separate from her husband. Adriana was left without any income and had two young children to support. In the midst of this difficulty, her sister convinced her to become a traveling clothing merchant. This business would help her to save and return to the same line of work. Today she has great dreams that she hopes will come true. For this reason, Adriana is requesting a loan so that she can invest in inventory for the end of the year.

Her priority is the welfare of her children, which is why she wants to organize her home and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of clothes for the year-end season.

loans.name: Remelina

texts.en:
This is Remelina, 37, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Roy, a company driver and father to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Remelina maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer’s order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers’ prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 2,000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.

Remelina hopes to give her children a good and quality education and dreams for her family to have a good life. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for additional supplies and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy 75 kg of chemical fertilizers and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers (80 kg) and pay for manual labor.

loans.name: Elisabeth

texts.en: Elisabeth is a 40-year-old woman. She is married to Nino, a motor taxi driver, and has adopted Maria, an 8-year-old child. Besides being a housewife, Elisabeth also assists her husband in generating income by running a kiosk business. Elisabeth really wants to increase her daily income by adding more products that her customers are looking for. She is requesting a loan of 4,500,000 IDR from TLM to add more products to her kiosk, such as biscuits, cigarettes, snacks, soft drinks, and mobile phone recharge.

loans.use: to add more items such as biscuits, cigarettes, snacks, soft drinks, and mobile phone recharge.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Mr  ADAMA est célibataire avec 01 enfant. Il  a 03mois et ne va pas à l’école et  il a 02 personnes  à sa charge (le bébé et sa mère).
Il  est étudiant en classe de licence II  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr  veut financer ses études supérieures.
 Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Après les  études, il compte travailler et se marier.
texts.en:
ADAMA is a single man with 01 child who is 03 months old and does not attend school. Mr ADAMA has 02 people in his care (the baby and its mother). He has been enrolled at the "Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou" (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works) for 2 years, and is currently in the second year of his degree course. Within Burkina Faso, this school is renowned for its training of civil engineers.
ADAMA wants to finance his higher education studies. During the holidays he undertakes practical internships to build his professional experience. After graduation, he plans to work and get married.

loans.use: to finance his higher education studies.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr:
Mr  ADAMA  est célibataire sans enfant.
Il  est étudiant en classe de licence II  professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  2ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr  veut financer ses études supérieures.
Après les  études, il compte travailler avec les entreprises pour avoir de l’expérience, ensuite créer son propre entreprise et participer au développement de son pays, enfin se marier.
texts.en: Mr  Adama is single without children. For two years, he has been a student in the Level II Professional License program at ESTPO (University of Public Works in Ouagodougou) because ESTPO is the best school for civil engineering training in his country.  Adama wants to finance his higher education.  After graduation, he plans to work with companies to gain experience. Then he plans to start his own company and participate in the development of his country. Lastly, he plans to marry.

loans.use: to pay for higher education.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more classes of  dried fish to  sell in the market.

loans.name: W. Ghislain

texts.fr:
Mr  W. GHISLAIN est célibataire sans enfant.
Il est étudiant en classe de Master I professionnelle à l’ESTPO (Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Public de Ouagadougou) depuis  3ans. Parce que L’ESTPO est une école de référence en matière de formation en génie civil dans notre pays.
Mr veut financer ses études supérieures.
Il fait des stages pratiques  pendant les vacances pour acquérir une expérience professionnelle. Il envisage après les études, travailler
texts.en:
W. Ghislain is single and has no children.  For the past three years, he has been enrolled at the ESTPO or "Ecole Supérieure des Travaux Publics de Ouagadougou" (Ouagadougou Graduate School for Public Works), where he is a graduate student. The ESTPO is a top civil engineering school in our country. 
W. Ghislain wants to finance his graduate studies.  During school breaks he does internships in order to acquire professional experience. He plans to work after graduation.

loans.use: to finance his graduate studies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for graduate school.

loans.name: Dix Yaar Benewende Group

texts.fr:
Mme JULIENNE est responsable du  groupe DIX YAAR BENEWENDE. Mariée, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants. Le plus âgé a 19ans et le moins âgés à 02 ans. Deux (02) vont  à l’école et elle a 03 personnes  en charge.
Mme fait la restauration (akiétié(couscous de manioc) et haricot)  depuis 05ans.  Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur. Ses clients sont les hommes, les femmes et les enfants.
Elle veut s’acheter  01 sac d’haricot et 20 sachets d’akiétié (couscous de manioc).
Elle  veut épargner ses bénéfices dans un compte. Mme  ambitionne agrandir son activités et améliorer les conditions  de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mme Julienne is the representative of the group DIX YAAR BENEWENDE. Married, she is the mother of three children. The oldest is 19 years old and the youngest is two. Two go to school and she has three people in her care.
Mme Julienne has worked in food preparation (akiétié and beans) for five years. She stocks up in a market in her area. Her customers and men, women, and children.
She wants to buy one bag of beans and 20 packets of akiétié.
She wants to save her profits in an account. She aspires to grow her businesses and improve the conditions of her family's life.

loans.use: to buy one bag of beans and 20 packets of akiétié.

loans.name: Terimbere Iii Group

texts.fr:
Elias fait partie du groupe Terimbere III et  habite à Cibitoke. Il a 35  ans et est marié à  Jeanine, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, âgés de 5 à 13 ans, dont  3  étudient.

Il  fait le  commerce  de poissons appelés ndagala depuis 5 ans. 

Il est son troisième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter   une grande quantité de poissons appelés ndagala, à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait  acheter des parcelles pour ses enfants.
texts.en:
Elias is a member of the Terimbere III group and lives in Cibitoke. He is 35 years old and is married to Jeanine, a farmer. Together they have six children, from five to thirteen years old. Three of the children go to school. 

He has been selling a type of fish called ndagala for five years. 

This is his third loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large amount of ndagala to resell and earn more. 

In the coming years, he would like to buy some land for his children.

loans.use: to buy a large amount ndagala, a type of fish, to resell

loans.name: Balimaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe   BALIMAYA  est constitué de femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 24 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur huitième prêt. Les sept précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait essentiellement le commerce de .tasses
FATOUMATA, qui est la présidente du groupe  est la première femme de la droite vers la gauche dans la photo. Elle fait l’achat vente de tasses et compte acheter avec son  prêt, trois dizaines de tasses avec les commerçants grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 45.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Balimaya group is made up of married women who average 24 years old and on average have five children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, other wives, brothers and sons in the Dialanikoro neighborhood in the town of Bougouni. The know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their eighth loan. The seven previous loans have all been repaid on time. 

This group of women mainly sells different types of dishes.

Fatoumata, who is the president of the group, is the first women on the right in the photo. She sells dishes and hopes [to buy] with her loan three dozen dishes from the wholesale retailers in Bamako. She sells her goods in a market and from home, in cash and in credit to customers who are mainly women. 

She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA, which will [used to] invest in the business and to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy dishes

loans.name: Massamba Sall

texts.fr: Massamba est un homme marié.Il a trois enfants.Il tient un magasin de vente de tissus et d'articles de mercerie.Son commerce lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 200 000f pour acheter des tissus et des articles de mercerie.
texts.en:
Massamba is a married man. He has three children. He has a store selling fabric and haberdashery items. His business allows him to meet the needs of his family. 

In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 200,000f to buy fabric and haberdashery items.

loans.use: to buy fabric and haberdashery items.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe  BENKADI  est constitué de 4 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 28 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles polygames dans le quartier Dialanikoro de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur quatrième prêt. Les trois précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de chaussures avec KOROTOUMOU qui est la présidente du groupe et la première femme de la droite vers la gauche. Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, trois douzaines de chaussures avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of four married women, who average 28 years old and on average have four children. They live in traditional polygamous families in the Dialanikoro neighborhood in the town of Bougouni. They know each other from neighborhood, friendship, and business ties. 

To increase their financial capacity in order to better conduct their business, they joined the micro-finance institution Yoro Yiriwaso, with whom they are on their fourth loan. The three previous loans have all been repaid on time. 

This group of women sells shoes. 

Korotoumou, who is the president of the group, is the first women on the right in the photo. With her loan, she hopes to buy three dozen pairs of shoes from the wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales in a market and from home, in cash and credit, to customers who are women and men. She hopes to earn an average monthly profit of 25,000 francs CFA, which will be invested in the business and used to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy shoes

loans.name: Souplienne

texts.fr: Souplienne est une dame âgée 42 ans mène comme activité un restaurant-bar dans un quartier de la ville depuis 02 ans environ. elle dispose d'une clientèle considérable malgré sa petite expérience. elle voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 25 casier de boissons et 02 bouteilles de vin rouge pour pouvoir mieux répondre à la demande de sa clientèle. les revenus lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en: Souplienne is a 42-year-old woman who has been doing business for about two years running a restaurant-bar in a neighborhood of the city. Despite her inexperience, she has a considerable clientele.  With this loan, she would like to purchase 25 racks of drinks and 2 bottles of red wine, so that she can better respond to the demands of her clientele.  The profits will enable her to better fulfill the needs of her family.

loans.use: to purchase drinks.

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь торгует на рынке товарами для дома. Она уже пользовалась КИВА кредитами, благодаря которым смогла увеличить торговый оборот и соответственно прибыль.
Старший сын Любви женился и живет отдельно. Младший заканчивает учебу в колледже и также планирует жениться. Были проблемы со здоровьем мужа Любви, но сейчас все уже в прошлом.
В этот раз кредит понадобился для увеличения ассортимента товара в связи с повышенным спросом. Любовь планирует продолжать развивать свой бизнес. Также она надеется, что скоро у нее появятся внуки.
texts.en: Lubov sells household products in the market.  She has already used Kiva for a loan, thanks to which she was able to increase her turnover and thus her profit.  Lubov's elder son is married and no longer lives in the family home.  Her younger son is finishing his college education and also plans to marry.  Lubov's husband had faced some health problems in the past, but now he is back to normal.  She needs a loan this time to expand her offering of goods so she can meet her customers' increasing demands.  She plans to continue expanding her business, as she hopes to have a grandchild soon.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of goods.

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Guillerma works hard to support her family.

She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising.  Guillerma is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business.

Guillerma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Lucresia

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Lucresia works hard to support her family.

She has a sari-sari store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising and a video rental business.  Lucresia is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to buy more grocery items to sell at her store.

Lucresia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 8 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell at her store.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 27 year old hardworking woman living in Masindi,Uganda.  She sells fresh and dry foods such as beans,rice and ground nuts.

Like most good mothers she dreams of educating her children up to the University level and setting up sustainable income generating activities such as rental houses for them.  Price fluctuation and inadequate capital to meet the high demand are her greatest challenges while her business plan is to own a food store. 

Grace intends to use the loan facility to buy produce such as rice and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as rice and beans to sell.

loans.name: Maria Nida

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Maria Nida works hard to support her family.

She has a basket weaving business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from hog raising.  Maria Nida is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials to her basket weaving.

Maria Nida has been sustaining her business activities through her past 3 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva.  She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James has been running his own business for several years where he sells construction material using the small amount of savings that he has.  He sells building blocks.

With this business, James has been able to overcome financial difficulties in his household, as he is the head of the household where he lives with his wife and five children.  Through his business, James has had to put in a lot of effort but it has grown little by little in response to those efforts that he makes and this has progressively enabled him to improve sales and as a result, the income.  However, due to the low level of available capital, it has caused him to miss out on large sales and that is why James is seeking a loan to buy more blocks for sale.

His dream is to improve his household's income so that his family can have a better quality of life and a better school education for his children.

loans.use: to buy more blocks for sale.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is from the Tbilisi city.  He is 46 years old, married and lives with his wife and two grown children.  One of them works as an assistant at the café and the younger is a student.  Robert’s wife works as a nurse at the hospital and Robert is a mini-bus driver.  Both of them get a monthly salary.  

As the existing income is not enough for the family, Robert decided to start a new business.  In particular, he plans to renovate his house properly and rent the rooms. Robert has requested a loan from the local financial institutions several times for a business start-up, but without any success.  His loan request was rejected each time because of lack of experience in his new business which is usually demanded by local credit providers.  

His loan request was approved under the framework of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo.  The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income.  With the requested loan, Robert will purchase building materials to renovate the house properly for satisfying the personal needs of his clients.  Robert hopes his business will be profitable and this will increase his income and the family members will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate the house and rent the rooms

loans.name: Rafiq

texts.en:
Rafiq is a 48 year old man, who lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and three children.  He is a farmer and has been raising seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 20 years.  During these years Rafiq gained enough skills and experience to run the business.  He chose this crop business because it  is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy.  Many national dishes are made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma.  Fresh fruits serve every table in Azerbaijan families and also make a fresh punch.  He usually sells his crop in the central bazaar.  His monthly income is 140 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Rafiq wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet market demand.  For this purpose he applied for 1,800 AZN.  He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.  This will be his fifth loan and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a t-shirt printing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed for her t-shirt printing business.

NWTF is relisting Mary Jane's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her t-shirt printing business.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah  is a 37  year old single mother of four children living in Masindi, Uganda.  She operates a retail shop and has been in business for twelve years.

After separating from her husband she decided to set up her current business and with the income earned she has been able to pay school fees for her children and optimally meet her daily expenses.  Inadequate capital to meet the demands of her customers is her major challenge while her dream is to own a wholesale shop.  Sarah intends to use the loan facility to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as cooking oil and rice to sell.

loans.name: Qanira

texts.en:
Qanira is a 46 year old married woman with four children.  She is IDP and lives in Bilasuvar IDP Settlement.  Qanira has been breeding cattle and cows for last 20 years. She was a housewife and her husband`s is on pension. 

Qanira usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for 5-6 months and then resells for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar.  Her monthly income is 120 AZN and this business is only one source of financial income for her family.  Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma.  Qanira also keeps milking cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors.  

She wants to expand her business and improve life conditions of her family.  She applied for 1,500 AZN loan to purchase two cattle, one milking cow and fodder.  This will be her third loan and she has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy two cattle, one milking cow and fodder

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction material (electric wiring, light sockets, bulbs, plugs, an electrical box) and pay an electricity contract

loans.name: Steven

texts.en:
Steven is 38 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children who are all currently in school. For the past 5 years, Steven has been working hard to manage his grinding business, which sells groundnuts. 

To help expand his business, Steven has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy G nut seeds for grinding, and will help Steven to generate greater profits and increase income and pay school fees. Steven hopes that in the future, he will be able to be more productive. 

Steven is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Steven, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy G nut seeds for grinding

loans.name: Kabalungi Agalyawamu Group

texts.en: John is a 42-year-old married man with three school-going children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. John carries out agriculture as well as operating a stall in the market, where he sells agricultural produce, including bananas, tomatoes, cabbages and onions. He accumulated capital from farming since he is a very hard-working man and started a business of selling produce to help him look after his family and pay school fees for his children. He is very trusted by his group members, who offer each other guarantorship to access loans. Seasonal weather changes and price fluctuations are John's major challenges while his dream is to own a food store that can sustainably supply his customers year-round. John intends to use this loan to buy produce such as bananas and onions to sell.

loans.use: to buy produce such as bananas and onions to sell.

loans.name: Gofrey

texts.en:
Gofrey is a 27-year-old married man with three children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He carries out agriculture, specializing in crop growing like maize and beans for commercial use. He started from farming on a small scale where he accumulated capital to buy produce from other farmers. Through this business, he has been able to look after his wife and three children and construct a house. His personal dream is to educate his children up to the university level while his business desire is to own a food store that can sustainably supply the whole region. 

Gofrey intends to use the loan to buy maize to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize to sell.

loans.name: Pambugane

texts.pt:
Casado e mae de 5 filhos, 2 dos quais frequentam a Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta ninguém.
É comerciante vende frangos de corte e com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar pintos, vitaminas, ração e vacinas para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. 
No futuro deseja iniciar uma nova actividade comercial para subir a sua receita mensal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é ter fundos que possam ajudar a ela a conseguir ampliar a sua criação de frangos e adquirir outros produtos comerciais.
texts.en:
Pambugane is married and the mother of five children, two of whom attend school. She lives with her family in a house she owns and doesn't support anyone else.
She's a trader who sells broiler chickens. With the current loan she intends to purchase chicks, vitamins, feed and vaccines in order to increase her stock.
In the future she wishes to start a new business in order to increase her monthly income. For that reason she pledges to repay the loan as scheduled so that she can request more loans from Hluvuku.
The challenge she faces is having funds that help her to expand her chicken raising business and to buy other types of merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase chicks, vitamins, feed and vaccines for raising broiler chickens.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.pt:
solteira de 45 anos de idade, mae de 5 filhos estudantes e não sustenta mais ninguém.
É pensionista e com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção (cimento, areia, pedra, ferro e outros) para ampliar a sua casa. 
No futuro deseja concluir a sua para garantir o melhor conforto para sua familia. 
O desafio é concluir a casa para tal irá solicitar mais emprestimo a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
Beatriz is 45, and a single mother of five children who are all in school. She does not support anyone else. 

She is retired, and with this loan she plans on purchasing construction materials (like cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc.) to expand her house. 

In the future, she would like to finish her house to guarantee the greatest comfort for her family. 

The challenge is completing the house, and to do this, she will take out additional loans from Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials (like cement, sand, rocks, iron, etc.) to expand her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and maize and sorghum seeds.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 60 years old and widowed with four children.

Marilyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items, such as candies, curlers, school supplies, toys and other miscellaneous items.

Marilyn has borrowed and repaid 10 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the variety store for 20 years and also earns an income from hog raising.

Marilyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items, such as candies, curlers, school supplies, toys and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en:
Hannington is 30 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. He is married and has two children, with one of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Hannington has been working hard to manage his hardware store which sells cement and bricks. 

To help expand his business, Hannington has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to add on capital and buy more hardware items such as iron sheets to be sold, and will help Hannington to generate greater profits and expand his business into a big hard ware shop. Hannington hopes that in the future he will be able to start another hardware store. 

Hannington is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs, like Hannington, who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to add on capital and buy more hardware items such as iron sheets to be sold

loans.name: Betti

texts.en:
Betti lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with one child and she goes to school. She takes care of two additional family members. She operates a salon in a shop that she rents, and she sells her products on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last 5 years and works six days a week.    She also practices farming as her additional source of income.

She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT–SACCO to buy weaves, braids and hair treatments. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her goal and aspiration is to expand her salon into a bridal shop. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but has no access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and food.

loans.use: to buy more weaves, braids and hair treatments

loans.name: Ilidio

texts.pt:
Casado e pai de 2 filhos que ainda frequentam Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

É militar e também possui um negocio de oferecer serviços de papelaria e servicos de internet cafe. Com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar uma impressora e toner para melhorar os seus serviços. 

No futuro espera progredir na vida profissional e pessoal, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a mais na Hluvuku.

O desafio é melhorar os seus serviços possuir uma papelaria adequada e comprar mais uma maquina fotocopiadora..
texts.en:
Ilidio is married and the father of 2 children who both attend School, lives in his own house with his family and doesn't support anyone else.

He's in the military and also owns a business providing stationer's services and an internet cafe. With this loan he plans to buy a printer and toner to improve his services.

In future, Ilidio hopes to progress in his professional and personal life. To this end, he commits to duly paying off the loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

His challenge is to improve his services, own a good stationer's and buy a photocopying machine.

loans.use: buy a printer and toner to improve his services

loans.name: Pakuza

texts.en:
Pakuza is a 44-year-old IDP woman who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her husband and five children. She is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. She chose this business because it is profitable, and her fresh crops are in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.

Pakuza sells her crop in the central bazaar. Her monthly income is 120 AZN. Her husband  is a builder, but he does not have a permanent job, and he actively helps her to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Pakuza wants to expand the business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose she applied for 800 AZN. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be her second loan, and she has a good client  history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 56 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Norma is borrowing PHP 17000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norma has been raising pigs for four years and also earns additional income from a variety store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Ramazan

texts.en:
Ramazan is a 30-year-old IDP man who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 5 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and his fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.

Ramazan sells his crop in the Bilasuvar Settlement and sometimes in the bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His wife actively helps him to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Ramazan wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1800 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 46 years old and has three children.  Nancy is married and all of her children are in school.

Nancy is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Nancy requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nancy has been raising pigs for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Nancy would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Brilyant

texts.en:
Brilyant is a 46-years-old woman, married with five children. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) and lives with her family in the IDP Settlement. She is a farmer and is raising seasonal fruits and vegetables. She has 17 years of experience in this field, which makes her an experienced and skilled person in this field. 

Brilyant usually sells her crop in the central bazaar. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.  Her monthly income is 80 AZN. Raising crops is taking a lot of strength and working in the open air, which is very hard for her and that is why her son helps Brilyant. 

She needs additional capital to purchase seeds and fertilizers. This will allow her to improve the quality of products that she raises and increase the monthly yield.  For this purpose she applied for 1600 AZN. This will be her third loan, and she has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Prima

texts.en:
Prima is 40 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Prima is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Prima has been raising pigs for 13 years and also earns additional income from selling firewood.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year-old IDP man, who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and two children. He is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 8 years. He chose this business because it is profitable and his fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.

Ali sells his crop in the Bilasuvar central bazaar twice a month. His monthly income is 100 AZN. His father actively helps him to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Ali wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose he applied for 1800 AZN. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be his second loan, and he has a positive client history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a basket weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy materials for her basket weaving business.

NWTF is relisting Perlita's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for her basket weaving.

loans.name: Nazima

texts.en:
Nazima is a 53-year-old IDP woman, who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with her husband and three children. She is a farmer and has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 10 years. Also, she raises fodder for cattle. She chose this business because it is profitable and her fresh crop is in high demand. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.

Nazima sells her crop and fodder in the central bazaar and from her home. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. Her husband is a builder, but does not have a permanent job, and he actively helps her to raise the crops.

As these products are in high demand, Nazima wants to expand the business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover the market demand. For this purpose she applied for 1800 AZN. She will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. This will be her second loan, and she has a good client  history.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Serena

texts.en:
Serena is 54 years old and married with nine children.

Serena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (convenience) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

Serena has been in this business for 12 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Serena aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Itezimbere Group

texts.fr:
Déo  fait partie du groupe Itezimbere  et  habite à Gitega. Il a 48 ans et est marié à Sylvie, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants,  dont  3  étudient.

Il  fait le  commerce  de boutique (haricot, riz, sel,…)  depuis 30 ans. 

Il est à son deuxième crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il  obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d’articles (haricot, riz, sel,…) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Le gain de son commerce lui permet de satisfaire les besoins familiaux (alimentation, soins de santé,…).
texts.en:
Déo is a member of the Itezimbere group.  He lives in Gitega.   He is 48 years old and married to Sylvie, a farmer.  Together they have six children, three of whom attend school. 
His has a shop where he has been selling beans, rice, salt, etc, for 30 years. 
He is on his second loan with Turame.  With the KIVA loan he is receiving he is going to increase his working capital and buy various items such as beans, rice, and salt, etc, in order to earn more money. 
The profits from his business will allow him to meet the needs of his family, such as food and healthcare.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to buy various items such as beans, rice, salt, etc. to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Vaqif

texts.en:
Vaqif is a 43-year-old man who is an internally displaced person (IDP). He lives in Bilasuvar, an IDP settlement, with his wife and three children. He is a farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the past 10 years. During these years, Vagif gained enough skills and experience to run his business. He chose this crop business because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. 

People use fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetables such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served on every table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. Vaqif usually sells his crops in the central bazaar every week. His monthly income is 120 AZN.

As these products are in high demand, Vagif wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to meet the market demand. For this purpose he has applied for a 1500 AZN loan. He will buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Sadaqat

texts.en:
Sadaqat is a 31-year-old single woman. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) who lives in Bilasuvar, an IDP settlement. Sadaqat has bred cattle and cows for the last six years. 

Sadaqat usually buys small calves, raises and fattens them for five to six months and then resells them for a more profitable price in the livestock bazaar. Her monthly income is 90 AZN and this business is the only source of financial income for her family. Meat is in very high demand in Azerbaijan and people use it in everyday dishes like pilau and dolma. Sadaqat also keeps milk cows for personal use and for selling to neighbors. Her husband and father help her to pasture and sell livestock. 

She wants to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family. Thus, she has applied for a 2,000 AZN loan to purchase three calves, two milk cows and fodder. This will be her third loan and she has good credit history.

loans.use: to buy three calves, two milk cows and fodder.

loans.name: Temotia

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Temotia works hard to support her family.

She has a firewood retail business in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from raising hogs. Temotia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase more firewood to sell.

Temotia has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more firewood to sell.

loans.name: Welma

texts.en:
Welma works hard to support her family. She is married and has an abaca-plant weaving business in the Philippines.

Welma has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials for her abaca-plant weaving business.

She has been in this business for six years now, and she also earns additional income from raising hogs.

In the future, Welma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her abaca-plant weaving business.

loans.name: Nasib

texts.en:
Nasib is a 48-year-old man, married with sons. He is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person). He is a farmer and raises seasonal fruits and vegetables in his own garden. He has 17 years of experience in this field. The crop he raises is organic. That is why the market vendors respect Nasib and always come to his place. 

He usually sells crops in the central market or from his yard. He is also a driver, and sometimes takes people from his village to the city. This driving is a side job. His main financial income is from farming. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthy. Many national dishes made of vegetable, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are serve on every table in Azerbaijan families and are also used to make fresh punch.  His monthly income is 80 AZN.

Now he would like to increase his monthly yield and for this purpose he applied for 1200 AZN. He will use the loan to purchase seeds and organic fertilizers. This will be his second loan, and he has a good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizers

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita, 48 years old, is married and has six children, four of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 3 years, Anita has operated an abaca (species of banana harvested for its fiber) weaving business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her business. Anita hopes to send her children to college and to repair her family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy materials for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Taleh

texts.en:
Taleh is a 32-year-old IDP who lives in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement with his wife and one son. He is a farmer who has raised seasonal fruits and vegetables for the last 7 years. During this time, Taleh has gained enough skills and experience to run the business. He chose this crop because it is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. In Azerbaijan, people use fresh vegetables daily and consider them healthy. Many national dishes, such as pilau and dolma, are made of vegetables. Fresh fruits are served at every family's table and are also used to make fresh punch.

Taleh usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 100 AZN. As his products are in high demand, Taleh wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables. He has therefore applied for a loan of 2,000 AZN to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers. Taleh has a good client history and this will be his fourth loan.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools, seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a food production business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 18000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food business.

NWTF is relisting Anecia's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an abaca weaving business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15000 PHP through NWTF to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

NWTF is relisting Divina's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her abaca weaving business.

loans.name: Rubiela

texts.es: Rubiela de 40 años de edad es madre soltera de 5 hijos. Es una mujer a la que la vida le ha enseñado a trabajar desde su juventud, debido a la situación económica de su familia en especial una de sus hijas que demanda mayor atención porque se encuentra en situación de discapacidad. Su responsabilidad es muy grande por lo cual se rebusca la vida realizando oficios varios. Actualmente labora en una panadería, pero los ingresos que reciben no son suficientes para sostener su hogar, por lo cual desea montar un negocio destinado a  la  fabricación y venta de arepas. Para materializar su proyecto necesita comprar una hornilla, materias primas y adecuar la cocina de su casa que será su lugar de trabajo. Su mayor sueño es poderle ofrecer a sus hijos la posibilidad de una mejor educación y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rubiela, 40, is a single mother to 5 children. She learned to work at a young age due to her family's economic situation, and especially as one of her daughters requires extra attention due to a disability. Rubiela has a lot of responsibility, and has been earning a living from various occupations. She currently works in a bakery however the income she receives is not enough to sustain her household, therefore she wants to start a business manufacturing and selling of 'arepas' (corn patties). 

To achieve success in her project Rubiela needs to buy a stove and raw ingredients, and also to adapt her kitchen to be a suitable workplace. Her dream is to be able to offer her children the chance of a better education and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a stove and raw ingredients needed to produce arepas (corn patties)

loans.name: Soraida Del Socorro

texts.es: Soraida de 41 años de edad, sufrió el infortunio de perder a su esposo, razón que la motivó a buscar  una fuente de empleo debido a que tiene 3 hijos menores de edad, los cuales demandan muchos gastos. Labora en el sector de la confección de lunes a sábado, pero los ingresos no son suficientes para suministrarle a sus hijos educación por lo cual se dedica en el tiempo libre a la venta de ropa interior por catálogo. Actualmente se encentra solicitando un crédito el cuan invertirá en la compra de mercancía  para la temporada de fin de año, con el fin de mejorar sus ingresos y poderles dar a sus hijos una feliz navidad. Su mayor sueño es montar su propio negocio para dedicarle más tiempo a su familia y mejorar su condición económica y la calidad de vida.
texts.en:
41-year-old Soraida unfortunately lost her husband, a misfortune that motivated her to seek her own source of income as she has three young children and therefore a lot of expenses to meet. She works in the clothing industry from Monday to Saturday however her income is not sufficient to provide education for her children, so in her free time she also sells lingerie from a catalog.

Soraida is now requesting a loan to invest in merchandise for the end-of-year season, in order to improve her income and be able to give her children a happy Christmas. Her dreams are to start her own business, spend more time with her family and improve her economic status and quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise (lingerie)

loans.name: Fabio De Jesùs

texts.es: Fabio de Jesús de 46 años de edad es un gran emprendedor. Desde niño siempre soñó con montar su negocio y trabajar duro para ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Hace 20 años surgió su idea de negocio cuando detectó que en su municipio no existía un almacén destinado a  la venta de productos y repuestos del sector automotriz. Don Fabio es un hombre dedicado a su negocio por lo cual ha logrado posicionarse en el mercado. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de productos de dos líneas que quiere introducir con el fin de ampliar su portafolio de productos. Su mayor sueño es brindarles a sus dos hijos de 14 y 18 años de edad una buena educación y que no pasen necesidades.
texts.en:
Fabio de Jesús is 46 years old and is a great entrepreneur. Ever since he was a child, he has dreamed of setting up a business and working hard to provide his family with a better quality of life. 

Twenty years ago, a business idea came to him when he realized that there were no shops selling products and spare parts for the car industry in his neighborhood. Fabio de Jesús is dedicated to his business, which is how he has managed to gain a foothold in the market. Today, he is requesting a loan to buy products from two lines that he wants to introduce with the aim of broadening his product portfolio.

His biggest dream is to provide his two children, aged 14 and 18, with a good education, and make sure that they never have to go without.

loans.use: to buy two new lines of paint for the automotive industry.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La socia continúa en el banco comunal “Anna Jarvis III” y con la venta de comida. Ella es una persona responsable y amable que saca adelante a su familia. Solicita el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo sacos de azúcar, fideos, aceite y sacos de arroz. Está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: [Marina] continues to be a member of the “Anna Jarvis III” communal bank.  She is friendly, responsible person who wants to get her family ahead.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies such as sacks of sugar, noodles, cooking oil, and sacks of rice.  She is grateful for the loan and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia  es la señora Angelica, ella pertenece al banco “Manos Juntas” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú del Cusco – Perú.  La socia es una  madre de familia que tiene 3 hijos,  Angelica se dedica a vender productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de abarrotes pero aprovechando su comercio también es distribuidora mayorista de mixtura (Cotillón para fiestas),  principalmente de papel picado y serpentina, y esta actividad representa su principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia, Angelica está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mixtura para la próxima campaña navideña y festividades de fin de año.
Angelica está muy feliz y agradecida con KIVA por permitirle mantenerse y desarrollarse en su actividad comercial.
texts.en:
The member, Angelica, belongs to Manos Juntas Communal Bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She's a mother who has three children.  Angelica makes a living selling staple items in her grocery store, but to make the most of her business she's also a wholesale distributor of "mixtura," made primarily of confetti and streamers.  This job represents her main income and support of her family.

Angelica's requesting the loan to buy confetti for the Christmas season and New Year celebrations.

Angelica's very happy, and she's grateful to Kiva for allowing her to support herself and grow in her business.

loans.use: to buy confetti for the Christmas season and New Year celebrations

loans.name: Arjamant

texts.en:
Arjmant is 40 years old, married, and has two children.  He is from Iraq. Both Arjmant and his wife provide for the family.  Arjmant owns a gym, which he has had since 2006.  He has one employee. He has good experience in this field and is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Arjmant is requesting a loan for $3,000, which he will use to renovate his gym. He is aiming to expand his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his gym.

loans.name: Gunay

texts.en:
Gunay is 25-year-old married woman with one son. She is an IDP (internally displaced person). 

She is farmer who raises seasonal fruits and vegetables. She is a skilled person in this field with five years of experience. Her husband is a builder, but his salary of 60 AZN is too low to cover family needs. He helps her with the farming.

Gunay usually sells her crop in the central bazaar every two weeks. People use fresh vegetables everyday and consider them healthful. Many national dishes made of vegetables, like pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served at every table in Azerbaijan and are also used to make fresh punch. Her monthly income is 150 AZN. 

She needs additional capital to invest in seeds and fertilizers and new garden tools. This will allow her to improve the quality of products she raises and increase her monthly turnover. For this purpose she applied for 2,000 AZN. This will be her second loan and she a has good client history.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers and new garden tools.

loans.name: Maxensia

texts.en:
Maxensia is a 24-year-old single mother of a child living in Kagadi, Uganda.

She is a teacher of primary school, and she was inspired to the teaching profession by her desire to associate with young people. She says that the meager salary she earns cannot meet the basic needs of her and her child, so her desire is to venture into farming after assessing its lucrative nature.

Maxensia intends to use the loan to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy land for farming.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a candle-making business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy wax, wicks, molds and other materials for her candle-making business.

NWTF is relisting Elvira's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy wax, wicks, molds and other materials.

loans.name: Henny

texts.en:
Henny, age 41, is married to Jakson, 42. They are blessed with two children. One is married and the other one is still attending university. 

In addition to working at a local agency, Henny also runs a catfish breeding business. This business was initiated in 2008. She constructed a pond by using wood and zinc with a tarpaulin inside. Now, Henny dreams of improving her business, but she has very limited capital. 

She requested a loan of IDR 4,500,000, which would help her to buy 500 catfish seeds, fodder and some building materials to build another pond for the seeds.

loans.use: to buy 500 catfish seeds, fodder and some building materials to build another pond for the seeds.

loans.name: Polad

texts.en:
Polad is 44 years old, married, and has three children.  He lives in Bilasuvar, IDP Settlement.  He is farmer and raise seasonal fruits and vegetables, which he has been doing for 15 years. During these years, Polad gained enough skills and experience  to run the business. He chose this crop business because it  is profitable and fresh fruits and vegetables are in high demand. Polad usually sells his crop in the central bazaar. His monthly income is 120 AZN.

Polad is requesting his third loan for 1,500 AZN, which he will use to  buy new garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.  As his products are in high demand, Polad wants to expand his business and produce more fruits and vegetables to cover market demand.  

People eat fresh vegetables every day and consider them healthy. Many national dishes are made of vegetable, such as pilau and dolma. Fresh fruits are served in every Azerbaijan family.

loans.use: to purchase garden tools, seeds, and fertilizers.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a 40-year-old government employee who works as a primary school teacher. A father to five children, he is married and lives in Kagadi, Uganda. He was inspired to the teaching profession by his urge to serve the nation, and he feels there is no better way but to teach the children of his nation. He does farming to supplement his low salary. Julius intends to use the loan to buy iron sheets for roofing his residential house.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for roofing his residential house.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Efua  is married and has three children. She has received formal education to the Junior High School level. She has a grocery store where she sells beverages, bread and drinking water at Whindo near Takoradi. She has been in this business for five years now. Her husband is an electrician.  

Efua helps her husband to care for their family needs as part of her responsibilities. She will use the loan to purchase more provisions to satisfy her customers. With the new profits from her expanded business, Efua plans to to increase the size of her store so that she can sell more things.

loans.use: purchase more provisions to satisfy her customers.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es:
Carmen es casada y tiene un hijo varón que está en etapa de crecimiento, tiene 1 año y medio. Carmen vive en la casa de sus primos donde cuenta con un ambiente donde se encuentra el dormitorio y la cocina, no cuenta con baño familiar,  las  habitaciones  son de adobe y el piso de tierra, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona San Felipe de Seke, de la ciudad del Alto.
Actualmente, Carmen trabaja de albañil en la zona de Puente Seke siendo el lugar lleno de tierra y cascajo, ella trabaja todos los días de la semana. El esposo trabaja de ayudante albañil también en el sector de puente Seke de la ciudad del Alto y ambos colaboran en el pago de los servicios, comida y vestimenta de su hijo.
El crédito lo requiere para la compra de materiales como estuco, pinturas, chapas y otros para la  Obra Fina de sus habitaciones.
El sueño de Carmen es poder comenzar la construcción de sus habitaciones en un terreno que tiene y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la primera vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO Y KIVA.
texts.en:
Carmen is married and has a growing one and a half year old son.  Carmen lives in her cousins’ house in a location with a bedroom and kitchen.  The family does not have a bathroom.  The rooms are made of adobe and have a dirt floor.  The house is in the San Felipe de Seke area of the city of  El Alto.

She currently works as a bricklayer further inside the Puente Seke area because this place has a lot of land and gravel.   She works every day of the week.  Her husband currently works as a bricklayer’s assistant in the Puente Seke area of the city of El Alto in La Paz.  They both contribute to paying for services, food, and clothes for their child.

She needs the loan to buy materials like stucco, paint, and metal sheets to the finishing touches on their rooms.

Carmen’s dream is to be able to start building their rooms on a piece of land that she has.  This will improve her quality of life.
