José, se le presenta la necesidad de realizar una nueva inversión al negocio, por esta situación solicita un préstamo para la compra de vitaminas, antibióticos, y otras clases de medicinas que sean necesarias para ofrecer a los clientes.
El manifiesta que los créditos ayudan a incrementar su inventario de medicamentos, por eso toma la decisión de fortalecer el negocio a través de esta ayuda, su situación económica está mejorando y su familia se mantiene el número de miembros.
texts.en: José wants to make another investment in his business and is applying for a loan to buy vitamins, antibiotics, and other medicines that his customers need. He says that loans help him increase his inventory of medicines, so he has decided to strengthen his business by seeking another loan. His financial situation is improving, and his family is still the same size.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and antibiotics.

loans.name: Chanthou's Group

texts.en:
Chanthou, 46, lives in a rural area of the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province, Cambodia. She has four children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. 

To support the family, she has been selling eggs and pork meat in a local area while her husband is a paid construction worker. The current business earns their family approximately KHR 48,000 per day and they can save about KHR 10,000 each day after daily expenses.

Chanthou’s group consists of four members who live in the same village and she is in her first microloan with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is now leading her group to request a loan of KHR 160,000 each. As the leader, she wants to use her portion to buy materials for building a proper latrine. She hopes to have healthy latrine for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy materials for building a proper latrine.

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda is 60 years old. She lives in Khoni District with husband Soso and son-in-law. Izolda is provided with a retirement pension. Izolda requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from the agricultural activities. In particular, they have three milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese production. Izolda sells produced cheese locally at a good price. Besides, Izolda has 35 hens and sells eggs locally but that is hardly enough for food for a three-member family. According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Izolda requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Her loan request was approved in the framewiork of a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. This start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to country rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With the received credit, Izolda will purchase piglets. After purchasing piglets, she will raise them and expand their livestock. That will increase the income of the family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, raise them and expand their livestock

loans.name: Samson

texts.en: Samson is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. His business has witnessed some growth over the years. He is a married father of three children, one of whom is in school. Samson is applying for a loan of 52,300 Kenya shillings to buy bars of metal, soldering rods and other requirements for his welding work. The challenge he has been facing is the high cost of materials. He believes the loan will enable him to restock his shop for welding work and that the income from such an investment will help him pay for his child’s education.

loans.use: To buy bars of metal, soldering rods and other requirements.

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Ферузе 46 лет. Она разведена и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Она работает в больнице медсестрой в экстренной хирургии. Она очень трудолюбивая женщина и ее коллеги любят и уважают ее. Феруза всегда хотела, чтобы ее дети стали хорошими и высококвалифицированными кадрами, чтобы достойно послужили своей Родине и народу. С такой целью она дала возможность поступить своим детям в университет. Данное время ее старший сын учится на 3 курсе Российско-Таджикском Университете по специальности экономиста, а ее младший сын учится на 1 курсе Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции по специальности таможенного дела. Зарплата Ферузы не хватает для оплаты обучения детей в университете и поэтому она обращается за займом для оплаты обучения детей в университете. Она ждет и надеется только на вас. Давайте вместе поможем такой заботливой маме, чтобы ее дети продолжали обучение в университете
texts.en: Feruza is 46 years old. She is divorced and has 2 children. She works in a hospital as a nurse in the emergency surgery unit. She is very hard-working, and her colleagues like and respect her. Feruza has always wanted her children to become good, well-qualified workers who can serve their motherland and people. With this goal in mind, she made it possible for her sons to enter university. Currently, her eldest son is in his 3rd year of economics studies at the Russian-Tajik University, and her younger son is in his first year at the Tajikistan State University of Commerce where he is specializing in the customs-related field. Feruza's salary is not sufficient for her to cover the costs of her children's education, and for this reason, she is seeking a loan to pay for their studies. Her hopes are only on you. Let's cooperate to help this caring mother so her children can continue their university education.

loans.use: To pay for her children's education

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set and a weighing scale so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:
Hamisi is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in Tiribe.

He is borrowing Kes 30,000 through Yehu Microfinance to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle.

Hamisi has been in this business for two years. He earns more income from farming sugarcane.

Hamisi has been sustaining his business activities through his own efforts with the help of loans from Yehu Microfinance. He dreams of repairing and renovating his family home in the future.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of his motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Merceline

texts.en:
Merceline is a resident of Malindi, Kenya. She is a dairy farmer who has been doing the business for two years. Besides this, the business grew and she invested in other areas of income-generating activities. She now also sells fish and water to the residents living around her. 

Merceline is applying for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy medicine for the cattle, purchase additional fish and also buy water tanks. Her challenge occurs during the low season when demand becomes low. She believes this loan will help her provide for the family needs.

loans.use: To buy medicine for her cattle, additional fish and water tanks.

loans.name: Bagrat

texts.en:
Bagrat is 24 years old. He lives in Ninotsminda District with his father and his wife. Bagrat has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was always rejected, because of low income and the lack of experience in his new business, which is usually demanded by local credit providers. 

Bagrat has a bakery locally and bakes bread which is sold at the local market. He has requested credit for the start-up of an agricultural business. His loan request was approved under a new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, as they are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With the received credit, Bagrat will purchase pigs. He will place them in an old empty farm building located in their yard. He will work hard on the farm to raise them and sell them for a higher price. Another part of the credit will be used for purchasing flour. Bagrat will bake more bread and increase the sales volume. That will significantly increase the income of the family, and Bagrat will be able to provide better living conditions for his wife and father.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and flour for his bakery

loans.name: Tsiala

texts.en:
Tsiala is 53 years old from Khelvachauri district. Tsiala has a large family: a husband and three sons. The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have 0.6 hectare of agricultural land, where tangerine and orange trees are grown. They sell the harvested products locally in an open market at a good price. Each member of the family works hard to ensure a good harvest. 

Tsiala requested a loan to purchase a milk cow. After purchasing a milk cow, she will be able to produce dairy products to sell locally. This will increase the income of the family and they will be able to improve their living conditions. Tsiala awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a mobile phone, a solar charging set, and a weighing scale, so that she may provide vital farming information to her community.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a 44-year-old married woman. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Twenty years ago, she began a stitching business in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is a mother of two children and her husband and son also work to contribute to the family income. She is in her 2nd loan cycle and has borrowed 25,000 PKR from Kashf. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials, such as spools of thread and packs of buttons and zippers in various colors. It will enable her to meet her customers’ demand without delay. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread and packs of buttons and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Rosa Isabel

texts.es:
Rosa, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para poder invertir en el negocio, comprando medicina natural y química, en variedad, como antibióticos, vitaminas, analgésicos, entre otras que son necesarias para los clientes.
Sus condiciones económicas se mantienen, porque considera que el préstamo anterior le ha permitido que su negocio permanezca estable, ayudando a incrementar los ingresos.
texts.en: Rosa has decided to apply for another loan to invest in her business and buy a variety of natural and manufactured medicines such as antibiotics, vitamins, and pain relievers that her customers need. Her financial situation is sound because her previous loan helped stabilize her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy antibiotics, vitamins, and pain relievers.

loans.name: Sandra Lisbet

texts.es:
Sandra, está viviendo con su esposo, no tienen hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, este negocio surgió como una fuente de ingresos para ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz por mayoreo y leña, que son los que le sirven para mejorar y realizar sus ventas, este préstamo será un gran aporte para que pueda comprar por mayor cantidad.
Su objetivo es mantener el negocio, mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Sandra lives with her husband and has no children. She sells tortillas and opened the business to provide an income source to help her husband meet household expenses. She is applying for a loan to buy wholesale corn and wood so she can increase sales. This loan will be of great help because she will be able to buy larger quantities. Her goal is to maintain her business and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and wood.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия живет в городе Турсунзаде. Она замужем. У нее 1 ребенок. Зулфия уже 6 лет занимается продажей одежды и обуви. У нее есть своя торговая точка на базаре. Она собирается взять кредит для закупки товаров с целью увеличения  ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Zulfiya lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. She is married and has 1 child. For the past 6 years, Zulfiya has been selling clothes and shoes. She has her own retail space at a local market. Zulfiya is seeking a loan to buy more inventory for the purpose of expanding the range of goods she sells.

loans.use: to buy men's winter footwear

loans.name: Ismat

texts.en:
Ismat is a 46-year-old married woman. Three years ago, she started her own business of clothing sales when her husband got severely ill. Ismat didn’t lose hope and contacted Kashf Foundation upon the advice of her neighbor to initiate her own business. She buys clothes of different designs from market in bulk at low prices and sells them in her community. She counts a good client list and most of her clients are her neighbors. Ismat is the mother of five children. Two of them attend school. Ismat wishes to send her other children to school but is unable to cover the expenses. 

Ismat has gradually improved her business, and now she has requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She is going to use this loan to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity to add to her current stock. She intends to use the earned profits on her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy an ample variety of clothes in a larger quantity to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a water tank for the new stall she intends to set up.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es: La socia  es la señora Marlene, ella pertenece al banco “Los Lideres” de la ciudad del Cusco - Perú.  La socia sigue trabajando en sus discotecas o centros de diversión nocturna, negocio el cual le ha ido muy bien, puesto que hace poco abrió otro local.  Marlene está solicitando el préstamo para comprar mercadería como licores y bebidas gaseosas. Marlene está muy agradecida con KIVA por permitirle continuar con su actividad económica la cual representa el principal ingreso económico y sustento de su familia.
texts.en:
Marlene is a member of “Los Líderes” [The Leaders] community bank in the city of Cusco, Peru.  She continues to work in her discotheques and nightclubs, with which she has done very well, as she recently opened an additional location.  Marlene is requesting this loan in order to buy merchandise such as liquor and carbonated soft drinks.

Marlene is very grateful to Kiva for allowing her to continue her business, which is the principal source of income and means of support for her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as liquor and carbonated soft drinks.

loans.name: Bahodur

texts.ru: Баходуру 20 лет. Он холост и живет с родителями. Он энергичный и активный студент 4 курса Политехнического Университета Таджикистана. Он учится по специальности Финансы и кредит и мечтает стать хорошим специалистом будущим. У него много друзей и они все любят и уважают Баходура. Данное время Баходур размешает учебу с работой. Он работает в рекламное агенство, но его доход не позволяет оплатить учебный договор. В этом году он заканчивает степень бакалавры и планирует поступить в магистратуру. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебы в университете. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Bahodur is 20 years old, single, and lives with his parents. He is an energetic and active student in his 4th year at the Poly-technical University of Tajikistan. He studies finance and credit, and hopes to become a good specialist in the future. He has a lot of friends who like and admire him. At present, Bahodur is both working and studying. He works at an advertising agency, but his earnings are not enough for him to cover his university tuition fees. This year, he will complete his Bachelor's degree and plans to enter the Master's program. Bahodur is seeking a loan to pay for his university education. He is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To pay for his tuition

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo con la intensión de invertir en la compra de artículos para el hogar, que son los que sale a vender a los clientes: cacerolas, lámparas, cocinas, zapatos, estos son parte de los productos que vende y que a través de este crédito va a adquirir. 
Con el préstamo anterior considera que ha mejorado sus ventas, sus ingresos tambien son mejor, pero cree que debe seguir invirtiendo para estar en mejora continua.
texts.en: Francisco has decided to apply for another loan to buy household items to resell to his customers: pots, lamps, stoves, and shoes. These are some of the products he will buy with the loan. His previous loan helped increase sales and income, but he thinks he should keep investing so that his business keeps growing.

loans.use: to buy pots, lamps, stoves, and shoes.

loans.name: Doris Iliana

texts.es:
Doris, tiene 20 años de edad, vive con su madre y una hermana, su padre las abandono desde pequeñas, ella vende ropa y calzado para ayudar a su familia con ingresos, aprendió este trabajo con su madre y tiene dos años de estar en el negocio.
Doris necesita realizar la compra de mercadería: sandalias, zapatos, chancletas, en variedad de estilos y para llevar a cabo la inversión solicita un préstamo que le permita incrementar el inventario y fortalecer el negocio con el dinero del crédito.
Su objetivo es invertir en mercadería para el mejor funcionamiento del negocio, crecer económicamente para ayudar a mejorar las condiciones de su familia.
texts.en:
Doris is 20 years old and lives with her mother and sister; her father abandoned them when they were very young.  She has been selling clothing and shoes for the past two years, in order to help her family with some income.  This is something she learned from her mother.

Doris needs to buy merchandise: sandals, shoes, and slippers of various styles, so she is asking for a loan so that she can increase her inventory and strengthen her business.

Her objective is to invest in merchandise to improve the business, grow financially, and help improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Maima

texts.en:
Maima is 31 and single. She is a mother of three children that are between the ages of 10 and 8 months old. Maima  is hard-working  and focused in her business, since she is the only  source of income for her children. She has been selling door locks, hinges, nails, and hammers for the past six years. 

Maima sells  twelve hours a day and makes a profit when she sells. With  her profit she buys more goods, and attends to her children's needs. She is requesting  a loan to purchase more door locks, hinges, and nails to increase her sales. She hopes to become a big businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more door locks, hinges, and nails.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bananas and chocolate.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert used his 20,000 KES loan to buy a cow for slaughter.  With the additional stock of meat, he was able to earn more profits.  He used the additional income from the business to repay his loan.  

Robert is requesting another loan for 50,000 KES, which he will use to add to his stock of meat. He hopes to expand his business in the future and open other business outlets.

loans.use: to purchase meat.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is 38 years old, married, and has four children.  He performs mobile phone repairs to earn a living, which he has doing for 10 years.  He also earns extra income from his rental houses.  

Fred is requesting a loan for 53,156 KES, which he will use to buy mobile phone accessories. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has improved his standard of living because his business has grown. Fred hopes to become more financially stable in the future.

loans.use: to purchase mobile phone accessories.

loans.name: Ngome

texts.en:
Ngome is a married man and he has been running a business selling clothes. Ngome is a father of seven children, all of whom attend school. He is a self-made man and wants to live his life with integrity.

He very carefully selected his business as he wanted to have a profitable business. So he started a business of clothes trading, thinking that he could easily do it in his house. This business really turned out to be a profitable one as men and women from the surrounding community started purchasing clothes from him. With the support of Yehu Microfinance, he has gradually improved his business.

Currently he has requested a loan of Kes 30,000 to purchase more variety of clothes in many colors and designs, considering the choice of his customers. He expects a gain in his net income and wishes to utilize part of the profits on the expansion of his business. He is thankful to Yehu Microfinance for its support.

loans.use: to purchase more variety of clothes in many colors and designs

loans.name: Rudi Alberto

texts.es:
Rudi, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita invertir en el negocio, comprando ganado y cerdos para aumentar su crianza, este préstamo le dará la oportunidad para mejorar su ganadería.
Con el préstamo anterior pudo invertir en la compra de ganado, para tener en la reventa, con ello ha logrado trabajar en este tiempo y ganar dinero de las ventas, sus ingresos le han servido para tener lo necesario para su familia.
texts.en:
Rudi has decided to request a new loan in order to invest in his business of buying livestock and pigs.  He wants to raise more animals and this loan will allow him to improve his farming.

He was able to invest in livestock, which he will resell, with the help of this loan.  This has allowed him to work and make money from the sales.  His income has made it possible to have the necessary items for his family.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Solim

texts.fr: Solim est revendeuse de céréales et d’ignames à son domicile. Âgée de 28 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants tous scolarisés et âgés respectivement de 09 et 04 ans. Son activité débutée en 2005 est en phase de croissance et elle sollicite son premier crédit auprès de WAGES pour stocker des céréales et de l’igname afin de satisfaire ses clients. Elle veut épargner ses bénéfices pour achever leurs logements (maison) en construction. Elle rêve d’avoir des grands magasins et d’aider son mari à améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille et surtout à assurer les frais de scolarité des enfants.
texts.en: Solim is a retailer of grains and yams, which she sells from her home. 28 years old, she is married and mother of two children, both in school and aged nine and four years. Her business, started in 2005, is in a growth phase, and she is asking for her first loan from WAGES to stock grains and yams in order to satisfy her customers. She wants to save her profits to complete her lodging (home) which is under construction. She dreams to have large stores and to help her husband improve the conditions of their family's life and especially to provide for her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy grains and yams.

loans.name: Mujeres Del Paraje Centro No. 2 Group

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es unida de hecho con su espeso, tienen 45 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 8 hijos de los cuales 2 estudian, se dedica a la siembra y producción de papas, inicio este negocio por la necesidad de contar con otro ingreso necesario para sostener a su familia, hasta ahora lleva 10 años experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien se dedica al comercio.

Organiza un grupo para solicitar un préstamo que sera utilizado para la compra de semillas para la siembra de papa y la compra de costales de abono orgánico, esto con el fin de mejorar su cosecha, esperando en el futuro tener mas terreno  y producir mas. Las demás integrantes se dedica al comercio y a la producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Juliana, 45, is married and never had an opportunity to go to school. She has eight children, two of whom are students. She grows potatoes, a business she started as an income source to support her family. She has 10 years of experience, and her husband, a merchant, helps her support the family.

She organized a group to apply for a loan to buy seed to plant potatoes and to buy sacks of manure to improve her harvest. She hopes to have more land and produce more in the future. The other members are merchants and farmers.

loans.use: to buy seed and other supplies.

loans.name: Andrew

texts.en:
Meet Andrew. He is married and has five children who all go to school. He runs a hardware and mobile money transfers shop in his hometown of Kalomo.

Andrew has been running his business for three years. He says most of his customers are local farmers and children who go to a nearby boarding school. They come to his shop to receive money from their parents and sponsors. He says his customers like transacting from his shop because he treats them with respect.

When asked what his biggest challenges are, Andrew is quick to say that he struggles to serve his customers on time, due to low working capital. He sometimes borrows money from neighboring shops just so that he can pay out because he does not believe in turning away customers.

Andrew needs the Kiva loan so that he can add to his working capital and make more commission. He says he will continue to grow his working capital until he is able to pay out customers without having to keep them waiting. He looks forward to taking out another Kiva loan once he has repaid this one.

This business is Andrew's only source of income and he uses his profits to take care of his family and send his children to school.

loans.use: to add to his working capital so that he can have adequate money to serve his customers.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 44 years old, married and has five children. To earn a living, she runs a food stall. She has been in the business for three years. She also farms to generate more income. Through Faulu Kenya, she has learned how to save her money.
Lillian hopes to grow her business in the future. She has requested a loan of 20,857 KES to buy ingredients such as maize, beans, and cooking fat.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as maize, beans, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jeriah

texts.en:
Jeriah is a business lady who runs a cafeteria. She has been running the business for 12 years. She has grown her business through financial support from Faulu Kenya. She hopes to improve her standard of living in the future.
Jeriah has requested a loan of 63,585 KES to expand her business premises.

loans.use: to expand her business premises.

loans.name: Mangale

texts.en:
Mangale is married and has seven children. He lives in Tiribe, Kenya. Since he dreams of having a better life, he started a produce-selling business 10 years ago. He has been able to build rental houses to supplement his produce business and has continued to farm.

Mangale is requesting a loan which he will use to buy beans and maize to sell. Weather and bad roads affect his business. He dreams of educating his children.

loans.use: to buy beans and maize to sell.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia is 22 years old, married, and has one child.  She runs a salon and a tailoring business to earn a living.  She employs one person in her tailoring business.  

Teresia is requesting a loan for 105,300 KES, which she will use to buy an over lock machine. Through Faulu Kenya, she has expanded her business. She hopes to open a tailoring school in the future.

loans.use: to purchase an over lock machine.

loans.name: Muli

texts.en:
Muli is 48 years old, married, and has three children.  He does tailoring to earn a living, which he has been doing for 11 years.  He also does dairy farming to earn additional income.  

Muli is requesting a loan for 32,298 KES, which she will use to buy fabric.  Through Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and learned how to save. Muli hopes to expand his business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fabri.c

loans.name: Balu

texts.en:
Balu lives in the community of West Point. She is married and has five children who are between the ages of 8 and 15. Only three of her children are in school.

Balu started work first by selling soap and she learned to sell from her mother. She sells six days a week from 7 am to 6 pm. She has been selling lappers (country cloth) for the past six years. Because of the quality material that she sells, she makes a profit and with the profit she buys more goods to improve her business. Balu has requested a loan to purchase more lappers for her business and her dream is to become an international business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers (country cloth) for the business

loans.name: Marvin

texts.es:
Marvín, se dedica a la venta de lácteos, vive con su esposa y un hijo, el negocio nació hace un año, lo realiza de lunes a sábado, lo aprendió solo, ya que necesitaba tener una fuente de ingreso para la familia.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo, pues quiere comprarse queso, quesillo, crema, y no cuenta con la facilidad económica para realizar la compra, este crédito le ayudara ofrecer mas productos y mejorar las ventas.
El objetivo de Marvín es mejorar los ingresos, a través  de la inversión del préstamo, a futuro comprarse una casa para vivir con su familia.
texts.en:
Marvín sells dairy products. He lives together with his wife and son. This business was born a year ago and Marvín works Monday to Saturday. He had to learn on his own about it, since he needed a source of income for his family.

He is now requesting a loan to buy different types of cheese and cream, because he cannot afford buying them. With this loan, he will be able to offer a wider variety of products and improve his sales.

Marvín’s objective is to increase his income with the help of the loan and in the future, to buy a house for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy different types of cheese and cream.

loans.name: Rosa Edelmira

texts.es:
Rosa, está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mercadería para el negocio, pues considera necesario aumentar el inventario, ya que se acerca la temporada de mayor  demanda, se comprara lociones de varias fragancias, cosméticos, entre otra mercadería.
Con el préstamo anterior logro tener un efecto positivo, su clientela ha aumentado, ha mejorado su casa haciendo algunas remodelaciones, tambien ha comprado laminas nuevas.
texts.en: Rosa is applying for a loan to buy merchandise for her business. She thinks it is important to increase her inventory as the best selling season approaches. She will buy fragrances, lotions, cosmetics, and other items. The previous loan was a success: her customer base has grown; she renovated her home; and she bought new glass.

loans.use: to buy lotions and cosmetics.

loans.name: Dilorom

texts.ru: Дилорому 39 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. У нее тяжелое условие жизни. Ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, и не посылает достаточно денег, чтобы хватило на проживания и обеспечение детей. Она срочно должна найти источника дохода и с такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес услугой швеи, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает кредит на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Dilorom is 39 years old, married, and has 2 children. Her life circumstances are tough: her husband has gone to the Russian Federation but is unable send enough money home to provide for the children. Dilorom urgently needs to find a source of income, and for this reason, she took a course entitled "Get Ahead," which was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she received a certificate. She wants to set up a sewing business because she has good experience in this type of work. She plans to use the income she earns to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food. Dilorom is seeking a loan of 3,000 Tajikistan Somoni to buy a sewing machine so she can start her business. She is waiting for your kind assistance.

loans.use: To buy sewing machine to set up a new business

loans.name: Changamuka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Joséphine  est entrepreneur, leader du groupe d’affaire Changamuka, âgée de 32 ans, mariée, mère de 4 enfants.  Son conjoint est un fonctionnaire de l’Etat dans une entreprise publique  «  la REGIDESO ». La  cliente est vendeuse des souliers usagers.  Elle installe ses marchandises dans le centre ville de Goma. Elle démarra son activité avec son fonds propre.  Il ya 10 ans, elle exerce cette activité.  Elle vient de réaliser 8 cycles dans le programme de l’IMF Hekima. Ce nouveau prêt  doit lui servir de s’approvisionner  avec 25 paires de souliers usagers.  En plus, elle ambitionne pérenniser  son entreprise,  ouvrir  un dépôt de vente poissons salés. La cliente remercie l’IMF Hekima pour  ses actions dédiées aux pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique.Il sied de signaler, qu'une cliente détient son bébé.
texts.en: The client Joséphine is an entrepreneur, and the leader of the business group Changamuka. She is 32 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Her spouse is a functionary of the state and works for the water company (REGIDESO). The client sells used boots. She sets up her merchandise in Goma's downtown. She started her business with her own money. She has worked in this business for ten years. She has just finished eight cycles in the IMF Hekima program. This new loan will be used to stock up with 25 pairs of used boots. Additionally, she aspires to make her business more durable, and open a store that sells salted fish. The client thanks IMF Hekima for its actions dedicated to poor women excluded from traditional banking. It is suitable to mention that the client is holding her baby.

loans.use: to buy 25 pairs of used boots.

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa is 41. She is determined,  hard-working, and a mother of four children, between the ages of 6 and 18, currently in school. Theresa resides  with her husband at West Point. She has a table in the market where she has sold "lappers" (traditional dyed cloth) for the past six years. She sells from 7am to 5pm every day. She makes a profit when she sells because she sells  high quality "lappers" and her interaction with her customers is good. She started  first by selling  charcoal in her community, and learned to sell from her mother.

A difficulty she is faced with is low sales during the rainy season. She will use the loan given her to  purchase more "lappers" for the business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more "lappers" (traditional dyed cloth) for the business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 37 years old and comes from Gaza. He is married and has 3 children--two boys and a girl. He owns crop land in which he plants seasonal plants and seedlings like peppers, zucchini, etc.

Ahmad asked Ryada for this loan in order to buy a new irrigation system and install it on his crop land. He hopes that this loan will help him improve productivity and thus improve his income.

loans.use: to buy a new irrigation system and install it on his crop land

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Inés, se ha decidido por un nuevo préstamo para surtir más la tienda para la temporada navideña, adquiriendo boquitas, arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos, queso, ropa nueva, con esta compra espera tener la capacidad para atender las demandas de los clientes.
Con el préstamo anterior, Inés tuvo un efecto positivo, mejoro el local de la tienda, agrego más productos, con ello considera que sus ventas han sido mejor, en su familia se mantiene el número de miembros, no han enfrentado ningún problema, ha agregado al negocio un rubro más y es la venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en:
Inés has decided to request a new loan so that she can stock her business for the Christmas season.  She wants to buy boquitas, rice, beans, cooking oil, eggs, cheese, and new clothing.  She expects this to give her means to meet her customers’ demands.

The previous loan had a positive effect on Inés, allowing her to improve her store and add more products.  She believes that her sales are better because of it and she is able to support her family.  They have not had any problems.  She has added clothing sales to her business.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel used his previous loan of 40,000 KES to buy chickens. He sold the chickens and made more profit. He managed to repay his loan with the additional income. Samuel appreciated Faulu Kenya for training him on business management. This has also helped him to grow his business. He hopes to increase his clientele in the future. Samuel has requested another loan of 84,442 KES to buy chickens.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Jose Isaias

texts.es:
José, se dedica a la venta de camarón, semilla de marañón y tambien es motorista, vive con su familia, su esposa y dos hijos, son dependientes de él, José aprendió el negocio por amistades a ser motorista y algunas reparaciones de mecánico, luego se dedico a la venta de mariscos que una hermana le enseño, ya tiene dos años de realizarlo.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de camarones frescos, de diferentes tamaños, esto ayudara a mejorar las ventas, comprando más productos, para tener disponible para los clientes, así expandirse más.
El objetivo de José es mejorar la capacidad del negocio, con eso estará ayudando a su familia con más ingresos.
texts.en:
José sells shrimp, cashew nuts and is also a driver. He lives together with his family, composed of his wife and two children, for whom he provides.

José became a driver and learned about car maintenance because of his friends. After a while, he started selling seafood because his sister taught him, and he has been doing so for two years now.

José is requesting a loan to buy fresh shrimp in different sizes. This will help him to improve his sales by buying more products and increasing his stock, which will result in the expansion of his business.

José’s objective is to strengthen his business, and in this way, to help his family with a better income.

loans.use: to buy fresh shrimp.

loans.name: Koto Allama (Confier Tout À Dieu) Group

texts.fr:
Koto Allama est un regroupement de femmes du quartier Koko de Koutiala qui vivent dans de grandes familles traditionnelles avec leurs maris, enfants et autres parents. Elles ont en moyenne 55 ans, sont mariées et ont en moyenne 5 enfants chacune.
Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les pagnes, les condiments, du beignet, des savons, etc. 
Pour augmenter la taille de leurs activités, les membres ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur dixième prêt de groupe. 
Kadiatou est un membre du groupe Koto Allama qui est la première assise de la gauche vers la droite et qui fait la vente de condiments.  
Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, des sacs de fakoye en cette fin  d’hivernage où c’est moins cher. Elle se procure de ses produits au marché de Koutiala et dans les villages. Elle vend son fakoye et gros et en détail  au comptant à la maison et au marché et à une clientèle essentiellement féminine. 
Tandis que les autres membres du groupe Koto Allama comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105 500CFA  chacune au  cours de ce cycle, Kadiatou compte réaliser 145 000FCFA.  
En plus du remboursement des prêts, elles utilisent une partie du revenu  pour faire face aux dépenses personnel et augmenter son fond de commerce. 
Elles souhaitent renforcer ce partenariat avec Soro Yiriwaso pour que les stocks ne soient pas rares.
texts.en:
Koto Allama is a group of women from the Koko area in Koutiala, who live in large traditional families with their husbands, children, and other relatives. Their average age is 55 years, they are married, and have an average of five children each.
This group of women does business in various items such as pagnes (colorful wax cloth), seasoning, beignets, soaps, etc.
To increase the size of their businesses, the members decided to join the loan program at Soro Yiriwaso. They are on their tenth group loan.
Kadiatou is a member of the Koto Allama group. She is the first person seated on the left and sells seasonings.
She counts on using her loan to buy bags of fakouhoye leaves, near the end of winter when it is less expensive. She gets her products at the Koutiala market and in the villages. She sells her fakouhoye leaves in bulk and retail, for cash at home and at the market, to a mainly female customer base.
Although the other members of the Koto Allama group count on making an average profit of 105,500 XOF each in the course of the loan cycle, Kadiatou counts on making 145,000 XOF.
In addition to repaying their loans, they will use a portion of the revenue to pay for their personal expenses and increase their working capital. They wish to reinforce their partnership with Soro Yiriwaso so that their stock does not become limited.

loans.use: to buy seasonings.

loans.name: Ricardo Antonio

texts.es:
Ricardo, vive con su madre de 80 años de edad, y con su esposa y una hija de 7 años, toda la familia depende de él, su trabajo es un lavado de vehículos y reparación de llantas, esto lo hace con un empleado, lo realiza todos los días desde hace 7 años.
Solicita un préstamo para la compra de seis pares de llantas para el negocio, este préstamo servirá para que Ricardo, pueda mejorar el servicio que presta comprando tambien accesorios, válvulas, jabón, entre otras cosas que con este crédito podrá obtener.
Sus aspiraciones son finalizar un año con más clientes satisfechos, poder ayudar a su hija a la graduación de preparatoria y pasara a la escuela.
texts.en:
Ricardo lives with his mother, 80, and with his wife and a daughter, 7.  The entire family depends on him.  His job is a carwash and tire repair.  He works every day.  He has one employee and has had the business for seven years.

He's requesting a loan to buy six pairs of tires for his business.  This loan will help Ricardo improve his service by allowing him to buy accessories, valves, soap, and other things as well.

His goals are to end the year with more satisfied customers and to be able to help his daughter graduate from her preparatory program and go on in school.

loans.use: to buy tires, valves, and soap

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para invertir en sus cultivos, pues su experiencia es que los prestamos le ayudan a realizar su trabajo, de sus ganancias paga dicho préstamo, actualmente comprara semillas de pipián, foliares, y otros insumos necesarios para esta siembra.
Con el préstamo anterior logro comprar lo necesario y aplicarlo al cultivo, saco buenas ganancias, ha logrado tener para la alimentación de su familia, la composición familiar no ha cambiado pero si su sistema económico.
texts.en:
Fidel decided to get another loan to invest in his crops because in his experience the loans help him do his job.  He pays back the loan with his profits.

Currently he's going to buy pipián squash seeds, foliar fertilizer, and other supplies he needs for this planting.

With the previous loan he was able to buy what he needed and apply it to the crop, and he earned good profits.  He has managed to have enough to support his family.  The make-up of his family has not changed but its financial system has.

loans.use: to buy pipián squash seeds and foliar fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para la compra de mariscos frescos, pescado, camarón, jaibas, considera que está trabajando bien con los préstamos que le ha ayudado al crecimiento del negocio, la inversion que realizara sea muy importante para que mantenga satisfechos a los clientes.

Ella comenta que las ganancias en sus ventas han cambiado, está mejorando poco a poco la vivienda, teniendo más estabilidad.
texts.en:
María is requesting another loan to buy fresh shellfish, fish, shrimp, and crabs.  She thinks she's working well with the loans, which have helped her business grow.  The investment she's going to make is very important because she'll keep her customers satisfied.

She says her sales profits have changed.  She's improving her home little by little and has greater stability.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and crabs

loans.name: Meshack

texts.en:
Meshack is 34 years old, married, and has four children. To earn a living, he runs a pharmacy.  He has been in this business for five years.  With help from Faulu Kenya, he has improved his business and become more financially stable.

Meshack hopes to grow his business in the future.  He needs a loan of 106,600 KES to expand his business premises.

loans.use: To expand his business premises

loans.name: Roxana Marisol

texts.es:
Roxana, está solicitando un nuevo préstamo porque siente que ha tenido muy buenos resultados de otros prestamos anteriores, con sus ventas ha logrado mejorar, en esta ocasión comprara pescado, camarón, conchas.
Ella comenta que su situación ha sido mejor en el negocio, aumentando sus ganancias, logro tener producto fresco, considera que esta superándose con su familia.
texts.en:
Roxana is requesting another loan because she has had very good results from her previous loans.  With her sales she has been able to improve.  This time she'll buy fish, shrimp, and scallops.

She says her situation has improved with her business, increasing her profits.  She managed to have fresh products.  She believes she's improving herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy fish, shrimp, and scallops

loans.name: Fredy Odilio

texts.es:
Fredy, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo porque en su cultivo anterior saco buena cosecha con los insumos que se compro, en esta vez está realizando una nueva siembra, se comprara abono, pago de mano de obra para que le ayuden al proceso.

Él incrementó las ganancias en el cultivo anterior, vendiendo parte de la cosecha, ha tenido mejor estabilidad en su vida, sus circunstancias familiares han mejorado con los ingresos.
texts.en:
Fredy decided to request a new loan because he got a good harvest from his crops the last time because of the supplies he was able to buy.  He is replanting and will buy fertilizer and pay for field labor.

He increased his income the last time, having sold part of his crop, he has better stability in his life and his family circumstances have improved.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, vive con su esposo y tres hijos, de 15, 13 y 10 años de edad, no tiene más ayuda que la de su esposo, ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas, esta actividad la aprendió en su familia, trabaja en lo propio y hasta el momento no ha tenido dificultad.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de mercadería como maíz, cal, gas, que son los que intervienen en la elaboración de tortillas, en especial obtener el maíz por mayor cantidad ayudándole para mantener un buen inventario y a bajo costo.
Los sueños de María es poder realizar mejoras a la vivienda, haciéndola mas segura para su familia, espera a través de las ganancias del negocio ir realizando sus planes.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and three children, ages 15, 13, and 10.  Only her husband helps her.  She makes a living selling tortillas, a job she learned in her family.  She works on her own and up to the present has not had any difficulties.

She's requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as corn, lime, and gas, which are what's needed to make tortillas.  In particular, she'll buy the corn wholesale to help keep a good supply at low cost.

María's dream is to be able to make improvements on her home so it's safer for her family.  She hopes to achieve this with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy corn, lime, and gas to make tortillas

loans.name: Mattic

texts.en:
Mattic, 33, lives in the West Point community. She is a hard-working mother with four children. Her children are between the ages of three and ten; they live with her at home and attend school. 

Mattic has been selling rubber dishes, plates, spoons, and cups for the past six years. She sells eleven hours per day. She is proud of her business because it makes her feel independent and she is able to contribute to the expenses of the family. 

One difficulty she faces is that she has fewer commodities. She has requested a loan to purchase more plates, spoons, rubber dishes, and cups to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more plates, spoons, rubber dishes, and cups to increase her sales.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is married and has six dependents. She has no educational background. Rose sells cooking ingredients at Akatakyiwa, which she has been doing for five years. Her husband is a carpenter. Rose uses her income to support her husband and take care of her children. 

Rose will use this loan to buy more cooking ingredients for resale. With the new profits, she plans to expand her business.

loans.use: more cooking ingredients for resale.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen is 26 years old, married, and has a three-year-old son. She runs a pharmacy to earn a living. She has been in this business for four years.  She has grown her business with the help of financial support from Faulu Kenya. She hopes to open other business outlets in the future.

Maureen needs a loan of 105,300 KES to renovate her business premises and add to her stock of medicine.

loans.use: To renovate her business premises and add to her stock of medicine

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is married and has one child. She has never been educated. Alberta sells cooked rice at Akatakyiwa, which she has done for two years. Her husband is a driver. Alberta uses her income to support her husband and take care of her child. 

Alberta will use this loan to purchase bags of rice, fish, and other ingredient to cook and sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alberta plans to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, fish, and other ingredients to cook and sell.

loans.name: Araba

texts.en:
Araba is single and has no children. She has no educational background. Araba extracts palm kernel oil for sale at Akatakyiwa, which she has done for 15 years. Araba uses her income to take care of herself and other financial duties. 

Araba will use this loan to buy more palm fruit and palm kernel to extract oil to sell. With the new profits, Araba plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more palm fruit and palm kernel to extract oil to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose previously requested a loan of 31,000 KES which she used to buy a sewing machine. With the additional sewing machine, she employed one more person in the business. Her business has improved because she has also learned how to keep business records. Rose hopes to grow her business in the future. She currently needs a loan of 42,727 KES to buy fabric.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth  is married and has 2 dependents.  She has no educational background.  Elizabeth sells  plastic bowls at Akatakyiwa, which she has done since 2 years.  Her husband is a mason. 

Elizabeth is responsible for using her income to support her husband and to take care of the 2 children.  Elizabeth will use the loan to purchase more  plastic bowls for resale.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Elizabeth plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: purchase more  plastic bowls for resale.

loans.name: Davlatby

texts.ru:
Давлатби женщина, которая всегда старается быть на ровне,  с развевающимся миром. Она вдова, ее любимый и заботливый муж умер,  она осталась без кормильца с 3 детьми. Данное время дети выросли, но до сих пор Давлатби обеспечивает их сама. Она решила найти новый источник дохода.
С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Она хочет организовать бизнес  купле продажей  золотых и серебренных изделий. От полученного дохода она планирует обеспечить своих детей с хорошим образованием и высококалорийными продуктами питания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  5000 сомони для покупки товара, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Davlatby is a woman who always tries to keep up with the modern world. She is a widow, her beloved and caring husband passed away, and she is now left without a breadwinner for her 3 children. Her kids are grown, but she currently still provides for them herself. She has now decided to find a new source of income. With this goal in mind, she took a course entitled "Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she received a certificate. She wants to start her own business selling gold and silver jewelry. She plans to use the money she makes to provide her children with a good education and nutritious food. Davlatby is seeking a loan of 5,000 Tajikistan Somoni to set up a business. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy jewelry to set up a new business

loans.name: Ana Gloria

texts.es:
Ana, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo, porque necesita comprar ropa para revender en esta temporada navideña, adquiriendo un pedido en blusas, ropa interior para damas, tambien pantalones para hombres y niños.
Ella considera que su trabajo con el préstamo anterior le ha ayudado a fortalecer el negocio, realizando la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, sus circunstancias han estado bastante estables, pues a tenido una fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Ana decided on a new loan because she needs to purchase clothing to resell during this Christmas season and has been receiving requests for blouses, women’s underwear and also pants for men and children.

She feels that her former loan helped her to strengthen her business selling clothes as a street vendor. Her circumstances have stabilized since she has had this source of income.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, underwear and pants.

loans.name: Ebenezer

texts.en:
Ebenezer  is married and has 2 children.  He has received schooling through senor high school. 

Ebenezer mills corn at Akatakyiwa, which he has done for 10 years.  H wife is a trader.  Ebenezer uses his income to pay for the children’s school fees and also to cater for his wife.  Ebenezer will use the loan to purchase more milling machines to make work faster and easier.  With the new profits from his expanded business, Ebenezer plans to reinvest into the business.

loans.use: more milling machine to make work faster and easier.

loans.name: Maame

texts.en:
Maame sells charcoal at Esueakyir near Abura.  She is married and has 2 children.  

Her husband is a farmer.  Maame has been selling charcoal for 8 years.  She is responsible for supporting her husband in paying the accommodation and utility bills.  Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal to sell.  She hopes to use the new profits to expand her business .

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy bags of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Aryee

texts.en:
Aryee sells waakye (rice and beans cooked together).  She serves it with gari, macaroni, meat and fish stew.  Aryee has been selling waakye for 3 years now.  

She is married.  Her husband is a driver.  She uses her income to support her husband and to pay her accommodation bill.  Aryee needs this loan to purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients for the preparation of her waakye for sale.  With the new profits, Aryee will expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice, beans and other ingredients

loans.name: Adiza

texts.en:
Adiza cooks Kenkey.   She serves it with fried fish, pepper and tomatoe sauce at Esuakyire near Abura.  She is married  with 2 children.

Adiza has been in this business for 5 years now.  She uses her income to support their children.  Adiza will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale.  She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business to mount a better stall for the sale of her kenkey.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Obaa

texts.en: Obaa earns a living by running a grocery store in the town of Esuekyir. She has been in this line of work for six years and sells items such as milk, sugar, soups, different kinds of soft drinks, canned tomatoes and fish, biscuits and other items. She is married and the mother of two children, and uses her income to help her husband pay their bills. She is requesting a loan to buy a variety of grocery items sell. With the profit she earns, Obaa plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy various items to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati sells soap and cosmetics at Esuekyir near Abura.   She is married.  

Fati has been selling cosmetics for 5 years.  She supports her husband  and the up keep of the family.  Fati will use her loan to purchase more soaps and  cosmetics for sale.  She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to acquire a shop for the sale of the cosmetics

loans.use: purchase more soaps and  cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta sells secondhand ladies and children dresses.  She has been selling secondhand dress for 20 years now.   

Alberta is married, her husband is a fire service personnel.   She uses her income to support her husband and to pay their utility and accommodation bills. Alberta needs this loan to purchase more secondhand ladies and children dresses to sell.  With the new profits Alberta plans to expand her business.

loans.use: loan to purchase more secondhand ladies and children dresses to sell.

loans.name: Gulnuza

texts.ru: Гулноза молодая, красивая и трудолюбивая женщина. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Доход ее родителей не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Она решила помочь родителям для благо получения семьи. Гулноза умелая портниха и шьет красивые женские платья. Она хочет воплощать свое ремесло в бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. От полученного дохода она планирует условия проживания, и сделать для себя собственный капитал. Она запрашивает займ на сумму  600 сомони для покупки швейной машинки марки «Чайка», чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Gulnuza is a young, lovely and hard-working woman. She is single and lives with her mother and father. Her parents' income is not sufficient to provide the family with all their necessities, so Gulnuza has decided to help them for the welfare of the family. She is a skillful seamstress and sews beautiful women's dresses. She now wants to turn her craft into a viable business. She took a course entitled "Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen and for which she received a certificate. Now she is fully capable of setting up her own business and becoming successful at it. She plans to use the income she earns to improve her living conditions, and to build up her own capital. Gulnuza is seeking a loan of 600 Tajikistan Somoni to purchase a "Chaika" brand sewing machine so she can start her business. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to set up a new business

loans.name: Aminda

texts.es:
La señora Aminda  tiene 52 años de edad, vive con su esposo y tiene un hijo de 14 años que depende de ella.
Doña Aminda vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, su negocio es la venta de abarrotería y tiene 30 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, sus clientes son los amigos y vecinos de la comunidad.
Doña Aminda es una mujer trabajadora con mucha ganas de sacar adelante a su familia, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos para vender y a la cría de ganado de leche.
Doña Aminda está solicitando el préstamo para compra de frescos, cosméticos, lácteos, jugos, pollo, agua, frijoles, arroz, azúcar, café, manteca, pan, churros, papel higiénico y harina. Con el apoyo del préstamo espera que su negocio crezca y le genere  ganancias,  para seguir invirtiéndolo y poder de esa  manera salir adelante con su familia.
Su sueño es seguir trabajando, para que su negocio crezca y poder  mejorar su casa.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2012.
texts.en:
Sra. Aminda is 52 years old and lives with her husband. She has a 14 year old son who depends on her. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo in the southern part of Honduras. She has had a business selling groceries for 30 years. Her customers are her friends and neighbors in the community.

Doña Aminda is a hardworking woman who is eager to help her family get ahead. She also raises pigs for sale and cows for their milk. She is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, cosmetics, dairy products, juices, chicken, water, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, butter, bread, fritters, toilet paper and flour. With help from the loan she hopes that her business will grow and generate a profit so she can continue investing in it and in this way move forward with her family. Her dream is to continue working so that her business will expand and she will be able to make improvements on her home.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - November,  2012.

loans.use:
to buy soft drinks, cosmetics, dairy products, juices, chicken, water, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, butter,  
bread, fritters, toilet paper and flour.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi is a fishmonger. She buys fresh fish from the market and fries them for sale.  Esi has been selling fried fish for four years now. She is married with three children. She uses her income to support her husband in the general upkeep their family. Esi will use her loan to purchase fresh fish to fry for sale. Esi will expand her business with the new profit.

loans.use: purchase fresh fish to fry for sale.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena sells vegetables like garden eggs, peppers, and tomatoes at Esuakyir market near Cape Coast. She has been selling vegetables for two years now. She uses her income for the general upkeep of her home. Abena will use her loan to purchase a variety of vegetables such as tomatoes, garden eggs, and peppers for resale. With the new profit, she wishes to build a stall where she can sell her vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of vegetables such as tomatoes, garden eggs, and peppers for resale

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina cooks Ga kenkey (made from fermented maize) for sale. She serves it with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce at Esuakyire, near Abura. She is married with five children. Sakina has been in this business for ten years now. She uses her income for the general upkeep of their children. 

Sakina will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her Ga kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profit from her expanded business for a better stall for the sale of her Ga kenkey.

loans.use: purchase bags of maize and fish which she uses in preparing her Ga kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Dories Esi

texts.en: Dories Esi sells yams, cassava, and other provisions at Esuekyire. Dories has received a junior high school education. She is married and has four children. Her husband repairs automobiles. She has been selling yams, cassava, and other provisions for the past four years. As part of her responsibilities, she helps to provide food for her family. Her loan will be used to purchase yams, cassava, plantains, and other food items to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase yams, cassava, plantains, and other food items to sell

loans.name: Marcial

texts.en: Marcial (pictured on the right with his wife and their family) currently uses firewood to cook and to heat his family's bathwater. However, due to deforestation, firewood prices are increasing. He wants to invest in a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester because it will allow him to process his cow manure into clean and renewable biogas. This investment will result in energy, savings, a decrease in deforestation, and a reduction of his family's exposure to soot created by burning the wood. In addition, the digester will generate potent organic fertilizer that will allow Marcial to reduce agrochemical fertilizer use on his family's farm. Also, he and his family will save money thereby increasing self-sufficiency. This loan will cover 34% of the total cost of Marcial's Sistema Biobolsa biodigester.

loans.use: To purchase a 6 cubic meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigester

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия девушка с прекрасной душой и прекрасными мыслями. Она всегда реализует свои планы и достигает успеха. Она не замужем и живет с родителями. Ее родители получают маленькую зарплату. Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами.  Зулфия  решила помочь родителям для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать свой бизнес услугой швеи, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для покупки швейной машинки, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Zulfiya is a young woman with a beautiful soul and wonderful ideas. She always realizes her plans and achieves success. She is single and lives with her mother and father. Her parents earn a low income that is not sufficient to provide the family with all the necessities, so Zulfiya has decided to help them out for the welfare of the family. To this end, she took a course entitled "Get Ahead" that was organized by the Association of Businesswomen, and for which she received a certificate. She is now fully capable of establishing her own business and becoming successful at it. She wants to set up a business providing sewing services, as she has experience in this field. Zulfiya is seeking a loan of 1,000 Tajikistan Somoni (TJS) to start her business. She is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to set up a new business

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El señor David es transportista, pertenece a uno de los  sindicatos de choferes de Bolivia , vive en la casa de sus padres con un acabado fino y pico de cemento; su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de  LaPaz

El señor David trabaja cinco días a la semana y mas de diez horas al día como transportista, el crédito lo requiere para el mantenimiento de su herramienta de trabajo (chequeo de frenos y todos los liquidos, cambio de aceites, cambio de filtros, alineamiento de llantas, etc.) para continuar trabajando y generando ingresos  y así cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua.
El sueño de David es mejorar sus ingresos y ahorrar para su vejez.
Es la tercera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en: David provides public transportation; he’s a member of one of Bolivia’s drivers’ syndicates.   He lives in his parents’ house that has fine finishing and a cement floor; it’s located in the city of La Paz’s Tembladerani zone.  David works five days a week for ten hours daily as a transportation provider.  He needs the loan to service his work tool (brake check, fluid replacement, oil change, filters change, tire alignment, etc.) to continue working and generating income to cover his food, electricity and water costs.  David’s dream is to improve his income and save up for his old-age.  This is his third time with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Rina

texts.es:
La señora Rina tiene una tienda de bario en su domicilio, vive en casa propia con un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento; su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona de Sopocachi de la ciudad de La Paz
La señora Rina atiende  su tienda de lunes a domingo por más de diez horas al día del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentación, luz, agua; el crédito lo requiere para surtir su tienda comprara azúcar, arroz, fideo, gaseosas entre otros.

El sueño de Rina en ampliar su negocio y asi generar mas ingresos para ahorrar para su vejes
Es la primera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en: Rina has a home-based, neighborhood store.  She lives in her own, brick house that has a cement floor.  It’s located in the city of La Paz’s Sopocachi zone.  She’s open for business from Monday to Sunday for more than ten hours daily and generates income to cover her food, electricity and water costs.  She needs the loan to stock her store; she will buy sugar, rice, noodles and soft-drinks, among others.  Rina’s dream is to expand the business to generate more income in order to save for her old-age.  This is her first time with IMPRO and KIVA.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her neighborhood store.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es:
María, se dedica a la venta de agua, gaseosas, frutas, de forma ambulante por las calles de la ciudad, ella vive con su esposo y los hijos, donde residen es propiedad de su madre, ella vende en las paradas de buses.
María solicita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio, comprando agua, frutas frescas, gaseosas, así como los gastos de graduación de un hijo, este crédito ayudara para tener una mejor condición en el negocio, su riesgo en la venta es la delincuencia que le puede afectar.
Su aspiración es ayudar a sus hijos a superarse, con las ventas del negocio espera salir adelante con ellos.
texts.en:
Maria is a street vendor. She sells water, sodas and fruit on city streets and at bus stops. 
She lives with her husband and children in her mother's house. 
Maria is requesting a loan to invest in her business, to purchase water, fresh fruit and sodas; the loan will also help her pay for her son's graduation expenses. This loan will help her improve her business; the risk is that she may be robbed. 
She hopes to help her children improve their lot in life; with the sales from the business, she hopes to help them have a better life.

loans.use: to purchase water, fresh fruit and sodas.

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es:
La señora Felipa  vende comida a los obreros que trabajan en las construcciones, su nivel de educación es secundaria, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos con un acabado de ladrillo y piso de cemento, su vivienda esta ubicada en la zona de bajo llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Felipa vende de lunes a viernes comida en las construcciones, del cual genera sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos de alimentacion, luz, agua;  el crédito lo  requiere para la compra de insumos como ser fideo, arroz, carne de pollo, de res y otros insumos requeridos para elaborar comida.

El sueño de felipa es tener instalaciones propias para su negocio y no tener que ir de     construccion en  construccion para vender.

Es la tercera vez con IMPRO y la primera con Kiva.
texts.en: Felipa sells food to construction workers.  Her level of education is secondary.  She lives in her own brick house with cement floor with her two children; her house is located in the city of La Paz’s Bajo Llojeta zone.  Felipa sells Monday to Friday at construction sites and generates income to cover her food, electricity and water costs.  She needs the loan to buy ingredients like noodles, rice, chicken, beef and other ingredients needed to make the food.  Felipa’s dream is to have a proper place for her business and not have to go out to construction sites to sell.  This is her third time with IMPRO and first with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy noodles, rice, chicken, beef and other food-preparation ingredients.

loans.name: Gulkan

texts.ru: Гулкан 60 лет, вдова, имеет 9 детей.Она является матерью героиней Гулкан. По характеру она очень спокойная, доброжелательная и трудолюбивая.В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, 17 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством, стартовав бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Гулкан  и помощи детей в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коров с приплодом, 15 овец и 2 лошади, продажа молока приносит около 12,000 сом в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гулкан обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 95,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. Часть доходов от кредита Гулкан будет вкладывать на увеличение своего хозяйства. Она мечтает купить бытовую технику для дома.
texts.en: Gulkan is a 60-year-old widow. She has 9 children, a fact that earned her the title of "Mother Heroine" which was awarded to mothers of large families. She is a calm, kind-hearted and hard-working woman by nature. As the main breadwinner of the family, 17 years ago she began to work in animal husbandry, starting her business with a sum of only 15,000 Kyrgyzstan Som (KGS.) Thanks to Gulkan's hard work and the help of her children, her farm now includes 2 cows and their calves, 15 sheep and 2 horses, and brings in a monthly income of around 12,000 Som from the sale of milk. For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulkan has approached Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 95,000 Som (KGS) to buy more head of livestock. She plans to use part of the income generated by this loan to expand her farm, and she also dreams of purchasing electrical appliances for her house.

loans.use: To purchase 2 cows and five sheep

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза 42 года, замужем, имеет 5 детей. Роза во времена Советского Союза занималась полеводством в колхозе и в качестве дополнительного источника дохода для своей семьи, 5 лет назад начала заниматься животноводством, стартовав бизнес с суммы в 80,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Роза в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется очень развитое хозяйство, большое количество скота и машина.Ежемесячно только от продажи молока хозяйка получает прибыль 4,000 KGS. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В ближайшее время она планирует женить сына, до свадьбы ей необходимо сделать ремонт дома и построить сарай.
texts.en: Roza is 42 years old, married, and the mother of five children. During the Soviet  times, she used to grow produce at a collective farm. As an additional source of income for her family, five years ago she started raising livestock, having launched her business with the starting capital of 80,000 KGS. Thanks to Roza’s hard work, she now has a very developed farm, with a large livestock headcount and a car. Every month,  she earns about 4,000 KGS only from the sales of dairy products. In order to develop her business further, Roza turned to “Bai Tushum & Partners” for a loan in the amount of 70,000 KGS  intended  for the purchase of additional livestock. In the near future, she plans to pay for her son's wedding. Before the wedding, she needs to repair her house and build a shed.

loans.use: to purchase 10 sheep and sheep feed.

loans.name: Rene Enrique

texts.es:
René, necesita un nuevo préstamo, para invertir en el cultivo de granos básicos, se comprara abono, foliares, pago de mano de obra, con esto podrá sacar su nuevo cultivo, con una buena producción.
El manifiesta que sus utilidades han sido mejor, con el préstamo anterior realizo una inversión que hasta el momento los resultados le han permitido comprar la alimentación y vestuario a su familia, gracias al crédito kiva, mejorara sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
René needs a new loan that he'll use to grow basic grains. He will purchase fertilizer and plants and he'll pay for labor so that he can get a new crop with a good level of production.
He reports that his profits have improved. With the investment he made with the previous loan he got results that have allowed him to provide his family with food and clothing thus far. Thanks to his Kiva loan he'll improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and plants, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Leonidas Alexander

texts.es:
Leónidas, se dedica al cultivo de maíz, tiene 22 años de edad, está soltero, vive con sus padres y hermanos, trabaja en la siembra de granos básicos, aprendió con su familia y unos amigos y tiene dos años realizando el trabajo.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de abono, herbicidas, pago de mano de obra para que le ayuden a realizar la tarea, este préstamo le dará el recurso económico para que pueda realizar su trabajo y pueda tener resultados satisfactorios en la cosecha. 
La aspiración de Leónidas es poderse superar con una carrera universitaria, para mejorar su futuro y las oportunidades.
texts.en:
Leónidas grows corn. He is 22 years old, single, and lives with his parents and siblings. He grows basic grains, which he learned from his parents and some friends. He has been doing this work for two years.

He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer and herbicide and to pay for labor to do the work. This loan will give him the financial resources to do the work and have satisfactory results with the harvest. Leónidas aspires to being able to get ahead by finishing college and improving his future and opportunities.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Paxboch Group

texts.es:
La señora Santos Margarita esta casada, tiene 52 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene 6 hijos de los cuales ninguno estudia, se dedica a la crianza de animales domésticos, gallinas, cerdos y otros, inició este trabajo con la crianza de gallinas ponedoras y hasta el momento lleva 7 años de experiencia, cuenta con al apoyo de su esposo que se dedica al aserradero.

Organiza un grupo para poder solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para la compra de cerdos para crianza, espera contar con una granja de muchos animales domésticos de varias clases. Las demás integrantes se dedican a la crianza de animales y a la venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Santos Margarita is 52 years old and married. She never had the opportunity to study. She has six children, none of whom goes to school. She raises domestic animals such as chickens, pigs, etc. She first started this business by raising laying hens, and so far she has gotten seven years' worth of experience. She gets help from her husband who works in a sawmill.
She organized a communal bank in order to request a loan which she'll use to purchase pigs for raising. She hopes to own a farm with several domestic animals of various kinds. The other members of the communal bank raise animals and sell clothing.

loans.use: to purchase pigs.
